About The Game:
Game Outlines
Heropath is a fantasy game that incorporates features of classic Eurogame
In this story, the heroes join together to eradicate evil forces from their land. Although heroes start the game together, they end up each on their own path experiencing unique places, facing vicious monsters and struggling to gain power. The hero that obtains the most power will be the one to slay the dragon.
Each hero will need to tactfully decide when to cooperate and when to be deceitful. As evil continues to rise throughout the game, the real competition is not against fellow heroes but rather the game itself.
Heropath is played with 2 to 4 players, although there is an option to play with 6 players (with expansion packs).
This game doesn't just incorporate battle strategies, but also requires precise logistic planning and efficient resource management.
Game Features
Testers reviewing the game: Heropath
PLAY

Game Innovations:
This game combines a fantasy game with a Eurogame by incorporating three preexisting mechanisms:
        1. CDR - Card Draft Rotation
        2. FOW - Fog Of War
        3. SOE - Scale Of Evil
Mechanism Description:
 Regarding mechanism 1 - CDR
CDR enables the accumulation of power and players being able to choose their preferred game approach. This is done by; shuffling the cards between all players before the game begins, and allowing each hero to collect their preferred tools and methods.
 Regarding mechanism 2 - FOW
Same FOW as in the classic computer game Warcraft, where a vast map was displayed to the player. Although in Heropath the map has thick, black smoke covering the land. In beginning stages the smoke effectively hides unrevealed spots where enemies are hiding. This effect will materialize as players advance further in the game.
 Regarding mechanism 3 - SOE
In this game, players must manage their steps wisely. With every advancement and power gain, your companions (who are playing against you) are advancing as well.
This creates harder battle arenas. Due to fear of losing, heroes may skip the station where the weak dragon is hiding, and in turn they are left defeated.
Resource Management
In this game, you must manage your resources more efficiently than that of the opposing participants. The more the heroes advance, the enemies’ power advance as well. The game does not sit idly.
  Player Interaction
One of the interesting features included in this game is the direct player interaction.
In so many games, especially Eurogames, there can be such little interaction that players can go almost the entire game without running into each other.
     The interaction in this game raises the bar to the next level, unlike Eurogames, this game includes:
1. Trading between heroes
2. Stealing from other heroes
3. Causing direct and indirect damage by using accessories/magic  
4. Ambushing and tossing other players into the Goblin Prison
All of these interactions are happening while players remain oblivious to the fact that the game itself is simultaneously causing conflict and damage to the participants. The game wants to unexpectedly undermine you, and ultimately defeat you with your own preferred playing method.
Expansion I: With Allies
"Now I shall haunt you, until you know the wrath of the flames, for this is my vengeance."
If one year ago, the Giant had been told how and where his life would take him, no one would have believed it, let alone heard of the goblin-slaying Giant. If only it wasn't for that one damn winter, up until then, our friend was a peaceful farmer, content with his share. He bothered no one and no one bothered him, until that goblin raid from the Caves of Doom – the night when their fury torched 1,000 straw huts, the night when the dank air was filled with the sounds of screams and weeping. That was also the night when, from the fire, the pain and the grief, a hero was reborn – and the legend was born as well – of the Giant who fought back. The Giant who faced everyone – and returned the favor twice over.
In this expansion:
Experience a wide variety of additional, diverse events. Marvel at new abilities that will grant you new powers.
Gather companions to join your campaign!
Enjoy the new additional dice. Get a new "Giant" character to enrich play.
- You can now play alongside more friends in a wider, richer saga, as well as increase the number of participants by one more player!
If you buy more expansions, you can increase the number of participants up to 6 players!
Expansion II: Fire and Light
"In dark times – in your hour of need – I shall return to you – that is my way."
These words were known to famed isolationists and those in-the-know as the final prophecy left by the Wizard. To others, it was no more than a rumor or a fable told to little children. But when the cursed hour arrived, and swarms of enemies sprouted from every hill, crevice and tunnel, it was also that hour – the hour foretold. The strange thing about prophecies, as you know, is that no one really believes in them, until he appeared… out of the darkness, the light appeared, and it shined in all colors and flashes, and the ground trembled at his feet – as he whispered under his breath: "Dance, you fools, dance all the way from here to hell… dance, but do not forget to whisper to the dragon on your way… the wizard is back – your time is over."
In this expansion:
Additional assortment of interesting and festive events. Discover additional abilities that will transform your play. Study new and exciting magic spells to learn new fighting techniques.
Enjoy the new function of magic dice!
Get a new "Wizard" character to re-diversify play. You may cast fire spells at enemies or lightning spells against the dragon!
You can now play alongside more friends in a wider, richer saga, as well as increase the number of participants by one player!
If you buy more expansions, you can play with up to 6 players!
Note: this "expansion" cannot be used without the Heropath "core game".
Link to publisher website: http://unique-games.com
In this video, we tried to give you a glance at the spirit of the game.

Getting the board game - Shipping information
We will be charging shipping once the Kickstarter has finished, based on the actual costs and information provided by our pledge manage after the campaign ends.
We do our best to keep shipping costs to a minimum.
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are located, we will either ship to you from our hubs in; the UK, China, or the USA.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have play tested this for 100+ hours, in events, even at the Spiel Essen fair, and will continue to do so during the next few months as we gather feedback. Therefore the game may be subject to change, which may affect our delivery schedule.

We also invite our backers to provide feedback on the current game version, this may change the exact number and types of components that will make go into the final game.

We are almost finished with the art behind the game, and are working closely with our manufacturers, although due to manufacturing and shipping there may be unexpected delays. 

Potential delays may occur with products that are produced in China. Common delays are often found in; production, shipping and customs. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others.

REFUND GUARANTEE 
We have prepared as much as possible for a successful production and Kickstarter. Although, if the game for any unforeseen reason cannot be deliver we will refund pledges according to the amount we received (after fees are applied).

TERMS & CONDITIONS 
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the Heropath’s final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project. 

After sending our confirmation e-mail, you have an 8-week period to get back to us confirming your pledge. By confirming you are agreeing that you will be receiving your order as it was entered into our pledge manager system. After delivery it is your responsibility to pay import tax or any other fees that need to be paid to relevant tax authorities. If you do not confirm our pledge after the 8-week period has ended you’re agreeing that we have fulfilled our obligations to you, and can take the full payment or donations received from you. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8-week period has ended. 

Please verify that your address can accept packages sent through normal shipping, unfortunately we cannot deliver to P.O. boxes.

If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign, and purchase the game when it is released. We thank you for your understanding.

DRAGONLOCK™ is an interlocking terrain system that allows you to create fully modular, multi-level 28mm scale village terrain for your RPG or wargame on your home 3D printer. Each set is delivered in a downloadable .stl format via our online distribution partner DriveThruRPG.com, and once you have the set, you can print as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. These terrain sets represent the culmination of over twelve years of gaming terrain design experience.
Fat Dragon Games is the only 3D printer terrain company that is part of the prestigious DriveThruRPG Community Content program, which includes Margaret Weis Productions, Monte Cook Games, and Wizards of the Coast’s DMs Guild. Our Dragonbite Community Creator program allows YOU to sell your own Dragonbite-compatible terrain designs on DriveThruRPG, RPGNow, and Wargame Vault!
By supporting us through Kickstarter, you get bonus models that won't be available later, and access to free stretch rewards. We have been in the 'print-and-play' terrain business for over twelve years, and have successfully delivered eight previous Kickstarter projects, so you can pledge with confidence that we will deliver a high-quality product on time.
FREE STRETCH REWARDS that will increase the size of the terrain offerings will be available to anyone pledging at the 'Realm of the Mountain King' pledge level or higher. Spread the word about this project to your friends and post about it on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc., and GET FREE BONUS MODELS as the pledges rise!
A standard dungeon wall piece costs around $0.40 in plastic to print yourself, far cheaper than factory-made terrain! All of the models shown were printed at 100-200 micron resolution, a common standard on most economical 3D printers. A nice starter printer that can print these files starts around $220 (see our F.A.Q. for more info on printers, printing costs, filaments, and more.)
Even if you don't currently own a 3D printer, it benefits you to support this campaign now. You can get all of the free stretch rewards, exclusive content in some sets not available later, and have a digital library of village terrain ready to go when you do purchase a printer.

Risks and challenges
Fat Dragon Games is a small company, and we need to be careful what subjects we choose to proceed with for production. One or two poorly selling sets could hurt our company severely. By putting potential projects up on Kickstarter, we can be sure if there is demand for that subject before devoting our resources to it. We also get to connect directly with our customers, rewarding those who are early supporters for a set with cool stuff like exclusive pieces not available to customers who purchase the set later on, and free stretch rewards. We have been in the print-and-play terrain business for over 12 years, having released over 180 terrain sets, and have had eight previous Kickstarter campaigns successfully funded and delivered, so supporters of this project can feel completely confident in our ability to deliver a high-quality product as promised.

campaign.story:
THE BEAUTIFUL WILDERNESS
Sometimes you need to get off the beaten path to find a beautiful landscape to paint. Wake up early, hike deep into nature, and find your perfect spot. Some paintings sell for commissions, others you’ll keep for yourself, but you’re always going that extra mile to find inspiration! 
LIFE AS A LANDSCAPE ARTIST
Sunset Over Water is an easy to learn, thematic game where you take on the role of Landscape Artists. Players simultaneously play a planning card to determine turn order, navigate the Wilderness, paint Landscapes, match commission sets and vie for daily goals.
Simple, Simultaneous Planning keeps players engaged as they make decisions. 
Commission Sets and Daily Goals give interesting options not just to the player who hurries, but also to those who wait and play wisely. 
6 Turns of Quick-Moving Play makes for a journey of interesting decisions and beautiful results, one you’ll want to take again and again. 
Solo Rules let you head out into the wilderness when you want to seek out some fun and beauty on your own.
Steve Finn of Dr. Finn's Games - renowned designer of Biblios, The Butterfly Garden, and Herbaceous - has created a wonderful compliment to Beth Sobel's stunning landscape art. Eduardo Baraf of Pencil First Games is at the helm of Sunset Over Water to ensure it is the perfect balance of simple play, interesting moments, and wonderful art in a fantastic package. 
Keith Matejka of Thunderworks Games - designer of Roll Player and Herbaceous Solo Play - created the excellent solo rules for Sunset Over Water. Benjamin Shulman of Jelly Bean Soup Games powers the graphic design and instructions.
Kickstarter Exclusive Muse Pack!
All backers receiving the Sunset Over Water game receive the Muse Mini-Expansion! The Muse Cards add additional personal goals to Sunset Over Water's beautiful play.
Give Mom the Joy of Gaming!
Sunset Over Water makes a fantastic gift and we are confident it will ship to backers prior to May 1st, 2018 in advance of Mother's Day on Sunday, May 13th.
In the unlikely, but possible case it is tracking behind, we'll provide you with a backer exclusive digital Sunset Over Water Mother's Day card to let her know the game is on the way!
                 Ant Lab Games did a nice 2-player Playthrough and final thoughts video. (which KS won't let me embed for some reason....)

"The planning cards add interesting decisions and tension...The illustrated landscapes are truly spectacular."

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sunset Over Water is Pencil First Games' seventh Kickstarter. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet!, The Siblings Trouble, GemPacked Cards, Heroes and Tricks, and Herbaceous all successfully funded and shipped to backers. Legendary Creatures is going to print. We strive to run excellent Kickstarters and deliver fantastic products.

Sunset Over Water is well tested and balanced. The graphic design is complete and the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but I have been making complex projects with countless moving parts and large budgets most of my career. I've gone out of my way to surround myself with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and I'm sure will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, I will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.

campaign.story:
Voir la page du projet en français.
The 7th Continent is a cooperative game of adventure, exploration and survival, for 1 to 4 players, inspired by the adventure books where ”you are the hero“. It’s also, thanks to the support of over 12,000 backers, one of the biggest board game worlds ever created!
The game became a reality thanks to over 12,000 backers, but the cost of making such a game is so high that a retail version is almost unfeasible. However, we wanted to give you another opportunity to get your hands on it: your last chance… to get cursed.
The Expansion “What Goes Up, Must Come Down” invites you to come and discover, or perhaps return to, The 7th Continent for some fresh adventures! Two new curses are waiting, each with their own unique gameplay elements, for you to discover.
In “A Prison of Clouds” you’ll find yourself aboard a Hot Air Balloon, in search of salvation and in “The Veins of the Earth” you will delve deep below the Continent in order to triumph over the Evil consuming you.
“Easily one of my favourite games of the year. This is an amazing game and possibly the best adventure board game ever designed. Excellent!”
Tom Vasel – The Dice Tower
“The 7th Continent is the best exploration game I’ve ever played. Every decision is interesting, the sense of cooperation and collaboration is strong, the freedom to roam is liberating, and the mystery is fascinating. This is a must-buy!”
Jamey Stegmaier – Stonemaier Games
"The 7th Continent is quite simply a watershed moment in enthusiast gaming. Encapsulating all that was great from the LucasArts adventure games of the past, Serious Poulp has crafted an analog experience that continually inspires exploration and invokes a constant sense of wonder. The ripple effect of this game will be felt for years to come in the Boardgame Industry and should most definitely be enjoyed by all."
Jeremy Salinas – Man VS Meeple
“This is the ultimate survival/exploration board game. Nothing else comes close to touching it in terms of its raw, epic scope, ambition and design.”
Richard Ham – Rahdo Runs Through
"I have over 50 hours of gameplay logged with 7th Continent and I feel like I have just scratched the surface. This is easily the best game of the year, and one of the best I have ever played in my life."
Lance Myxter – Undead Viking
Play solo or in a team of up to 4 players.
30 seconds to set-up the game, 30 seconds to save it!
1000+ minutes of thrilling adventure in a single game.
Relive the sensation of the adventure books where “you are the hero” that thrilled so many of us in our childhood.
No dice rolls! Make difficult choices and face the consequences thanks to the game's innovative mechanics that determine success or failure!
Almost 1,000 cards for the base box alone with hundreds of pieces of original artwork.
Join the expedition any time, even if you missed the beginning of the adventure or died during it.
Live a different adventure every time! There are dozens of random events and several alternatives for each individually numbered card.
There are consequences to your actions. If you kill an NPC, they will remain dead for the rest of the game and any options or alternatives that you might have had by letting them live will be gone…forever. Let them live and they might help you later. Then again, they might not.
An expansion with two brand new curses, each with their own unique gameplay mechanics!
This expansion, which requires the base box, is compatible with all previous expansions.
It includes over 250 new cards, including two new curses, which you will have to overcome if you hope to leave the 7th Continent alive. Each one will provide a unique experience, pushing the survival skills of both novice and veteran explorers to the limit.
This new expansion has its own “collector’s” box that – combined with the base box – can store all of the cards of the base box as well as all of the expansions (even if everything is sleeved) and other materials. It includes:
3 Storage trays
250+ cards
1 Hot Air Balloon miniature (+ alternative cardboard standee)
1 Barge miniature (+ alternative cardboard standee)
7 new Dividers
1 rule sheet
The curse, “A Prison of Clouds”, will send you on a whirling adventure OVER the 7th Continent!
Aboard your hot air balloon, you’ll soar over the continent thanks to an innovative wind management system, which will lead you to new, unexplored tracts of land…
You can land at any time by taking the Terrain card with the same number as your current Sky card, allowing you to continue exploring on foot. When you wish to take off again, simply make your way back to the card where you landed and your aerial adventure continues.
Take care though, as each trip will tax you. Hunger, confinement and violent winds will test your nerves.
Make short trips and improve your piloting abilities if you want to stand a chance of lifting the curse that keeps you trapped in this hopeless land.
“The Veins of the Earth” will drag you down into the bowels of the earth where an underground network of serpentine waterways spans the entire length of the continent.
Aboard a barge of aboriginal design, your actions will be limited as the current draws you ever deeper. Make the right choices at the right time or you’ll end up lost and doomed in the pitch black.
As insane and suicidal as it may seem, you have no choice but to forge ever onwards into the darkness. What manner of horrors await you? It matters not, as long as you can free yourself from this curse!
"Satchel & Journal" Binder
This new accessory will allow you to store all the “Quest Item” cards that you’ll acquire during your adventures, just as if you were jotting them down in your journal!
1907. A renowned explorer, you have just returned from the first expedition on the seventh continent, a mysterious land that was recently discovered off the coast of Antarctica and is very likely the last Terra Incognita in the world.
You are recovering from your adventure when, whilst reading the daily newspaper, you realize that several other members of the expedition have disappeared suddenly, for unknown reasons.
Coincidentally, you have been lethargic for a few days, feeling feverish and finding it difficult to get out of bed. A cold shiver runs down your spine and you are in a constant state of depression and malaise.
You are going to have to face the facts: an evil is consuming you from within. When night falls, you slip into a restless sleep unaware that, for you, this is only the beginning...
You start each new game by choosing one of the available characters. Each one comes with their own set of Skill cards that represent their abilities and personality (adventurer, herbalist, doctor, mercenary, etc.).
Keelan: an explorer and keen Botanist. One of the explorers available to you with an example of her Skill cards.
“The Voracious Goddess”, “An Offering to The Guardians”, “The Bloody Hunt”, "The Dark Chest of the Damned" - Choose which curse (or curses!) has been put on you from those included in the base box (4) or those in the expansions (5).
Your goal? Find out how to lift the curses you have chosen and then purge your soul of them. Each curse offers a very unique adventure and will take you to different places. Obtain the unobtainable, discover that which is forever hidden, and strive against the impossible.
Do you have what it takes?
A Curse that you can attempt to lift and its clue.
You are now ready to begin your unexpected adventure. Similar to the books where "you are the hero”, you will explore the continent by putting numbered Terrain and Permanent event cards into play, which will gradually form the game board.
Forests, deserts, caves and mountains - you will visit dozens of different locations during your adventures as well as encounter random events that coincide with your location.
To progress through the game, you will perform the actions available on the Terrain card your miniature is standing on, the Event cards attached to it, and the Character, Skill, State and Bonus cards in your hand and the Items in your inventory.
In order to perform these actions, you will use the Action Deck that contains your Skills and simultaneously serves as your life force.
Every action makes you draw a certain number of cards from the Action Deck. These cards provide a variable amount of successes and you must obtain a specified number of them in order to succeed.
Fight action: draw 2 or more cards from the Action Deck to perform the action. Get 1 or more achievements to succeed.
Failing when performing an action may have terrible consequences and cause you to get negative State cards, forcing you to discard cards from the Action Deck, and consequently reducing your life force.
Fall off this peak and you will likely get injured.
Want to stack the odds in your favour? You may choose to draw more cards from the Action Deck to get more successes. However, every card in the Action Deck is a bit of your life force, so when the Action Deck is exhausted, so are you. From now on, every action could be your last!
Thankfully, the Skill cards that you may add to your hand when performing actions, your Bonus and Item cards, and the help from your companions will make things easier for you. This is especially true when it comes to decreasing the number of cards you must draw to perform an action or by increasing your chances of success.
A faithful companion and a precious item.
The 7th Continent is a strange land with many paranormal events, hostile creatures and inhospitable locations.
You will have to use your best survival skills to overcome the varied threats you will face in this land, so that you can eventually lift your curses:
Find or craft items to help you escape risky situations or access locations that would normally be unreachable without them.
Gather food, by hunting or fishing, in order to regain some life force, returning Action cards from the discard pile to your Action deck. Make a fire and cook it and you’ll find that you’ll get even more cards back!
Look carefully at your environment. It contains many clues and hidden numbers that can help you uncover the Continent’s many secret locations.
There are countless surprises for you to experience along your journey!
A page from your journal that now allows you to use this plant when you see it on your Terrain card.
You can download the rules (.pdf – 56 Mo) or check this video (26’) to learn how to play The 7th Continent!

All the expansions and optional purchases from the original Kickstarter will be available during the course of the second campaign.
How to add optional buys to my pledge?
1. Click on the “Manage your pledge” green button at the top of the page
2. On the next screen, click on the “Change your pledge” blue button
3. Then, in the current reward box you’ve chosen, increase the pledge amount by the value of the optional buy then click on the “Continue” green button
4. On the window that appears, click on the “Confirm” blue button.
5. It’s done!
6. A few weeks after the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will open the “Pledge Manager” (PM) and invite you to fill it by telling us which optional buys you’d like to purchase and in which language (English or French).
 
If you want to sleeve the ENTIRE game, including the Stretch Goals and any other content made available during the campaign, then you have to add both optional buys for a total of $79 which includes over 1600+ card sleeves (the “+” is additional sleeves included “for free” for the upcoming Stretch Goals and optional buys).
What would a Kickstarter campaign be without some Stretch Goats?
After 4 years of work, The 7th Continent became a reality thanks to the support of over 12,000 backers. Without them, we wouldn’t be here today.
The cost of making this game is high, notably due to the quality of its components. Due to this a retail version of the game is almost unfeasible.
However, we want the game to live and continue growing as well as allowing those that missed out on the first campaign and/or some of its contents to acquire them.
This campaign is no doubt one of your last chances to take part in The 7th Continent adventure...

We’re two friends that love playing and making games. Also, one of us is pretty handy with a pencil.

The first Kickstarter campaign for The 7th Continent was successfully funded back in October 2015 thanks to the support of 12,103 daring explorers! Two years later, with a lot of experience from this first adventure under our belts, we’re back with some new ideas that we just couldn’t keep to ourselves!
Ludovic Roudy and Bruno Sautter
Two friends passionate about all things gaming! We’ve been working together for almost 15 years in the digital communication agency we created in 2002, then as Serious Poulp, which we founded in 2010, when the temptation to publish games became too strong to resist.

campaign.story:
Forest of Fate takes the Choose Your Own Adventure format and transforms it into a tabletop game for 2-6 adventurers, from non-gamers to experienced role-players alike. Tension and story build hand-in-hand over 30-60 minutes as you decide how to approach each encounter, with strategy, negotiation and over 40,000 words of original narrative.
You can find more information on the Cards of Fate website. Sign up there to receive alerts on any reprints or expansions for Forest of Fate, plus news on all our upcoming storytelling games!
Facebook | Twitter | BGG | Email
Top reasons to play Forest of Fate
If you grew up with Choose Your Own Adventure or Fighting Fantasy, Forest of Fate evokes that nostalgic feeling and lets you share it in a fun cooperative format with your friends and family - and it's (mostly) kid-friendly!
If you like the storytelling element of games like Tales of the Arabian Nights or Above & Below, you will love the tighter, faster, easier to learn gameplay of Forest of Fate
If you've been tempted by RPGs like Dungeons & Dragons, but haven't been able to find a group (or the courage to join one), Forest of Fate could be your gateway into the hobby - and it's much easier to introduce to your non-gaming friends!
If you're in an existing RPG group, Forest of Fate could be your next warm-up game, with its short run time and flexible player count.
Read John's full preview here.
The response to Forest of Fate has so far been staggering. As a result, you've unlocked every stretch goal I could throw at you. The game is now bigger and better than I could have imagined. Thank you!
Read Bod's full review here.
I was inspired to create Forest of Fate by the gamebooks of my childhood, the worlds of J.R.R. Tolkein and Terry Pratchett, and the amazing and varied scenery near my home on the South West coast of England.
My goal was to make roleplaying games more accessible by stripping back almost all the conventional elements, revealing a strong procedural storytelling experience that is:
Easy to grasp and "safe" for new players
Self-contained, and quick to play
Endlessly replayable
I hope I've succeeded!
Forest of Fate uses nothing but a storybook and high-quality cards for its unique brand of survival storytelling. It's compact enough to take anywhere, and has no small parts to lose!
Check out some of the gorgeous character art by the brilliant Milly Hanson:
The Thief
The Bard
The Ranger
The Warrior
Here's a simplified interaction between a Character and an Encounter, to demonstrate the anatomy of the most important cards.
The Story Book is the heart and soul of Forest of Fate. It contains 1,164 paragraphs to spark your imagination, describing the encounters you'll face and the actions you'll take.
A computer rendering of the Deluxe Story Book (Hero tier and above)
You have three choices when it comes to using the Story Book:
The content and gameplay for all three versions is identical, though I recommend the digital version - it can be updated later if we spot mistakes, and more importantly helps to save the forests we love!
I've tried to make all rewards simple and fair. Please note that this campaign will not be using a pledge manager. Once it's over, it's over. If you've got your eye on something you should grab it while you can!
Forest of Fate is the debut game from Cards of Fate. As a startup publisher without a great deal of capital to invest or a name in the industry, I view Kickstarter as an exciting opportunity to help build a small community around my games and reward those who share my vision.
Playtesting (all components pictured are early prototypes, not final)
Thank you for reading, and I hope I've inspired you to try Forest of Fate.
Thanks also to the fine folk at Tabletop Audio for the ambient forest sounds used in my videos. They're highly recommended if you want to really immerse yourself in the game!

campaign.story:
Are you sick of predefined artifacts in your board games?  
Forge your own!
Merge together dozens of items and powerful spells. Pick them up before your opponents do to upgrade your artifact. Smash approaching monsters and save the village.
One artifact to rule them all!  
Combine spells and items to upgrade your artifact! 
15 minutes per player - a short and replayable game! 
2 minutes to explain - simple yet deep gameplay! 
1 minute to set up - just shuffle and play! 
10 second player turns - no bookkeeping, only action!
Enchanters is a fantasy card drafting game. Players take turns to go on quests to take cards from the Journey track. Each one collects Items on one stack and Enchantments on the other to craft a magical artifact. Part of every card taken stays with them until the end of the game. When monsters approach, they journey onward to defeat in a deterministic combat encounter (that takes just few seconds) and score points. From time to time players rest to gain crystals or heal wounds.
Richard 'Rahdo' Ham really enjoyed our game. Hear what he has to say about it:
                                                                                                                                                             6 Village cards (63x88mm)
6 Kingdom decks (150 cards total) (63x88mm)
33 wound tiles 
40 crystal tiles 
Rulebook
                                                                                    Four eco leather Player Mats 28x12cm (11 inch x 4,7 inch), one for each player. There is no additional cost for shipping. 
One eco leather Game Mat 70x40cm (27,5 inch x 15,5 inch). This item is shipped separately.  See Shipping Section for more details. 
  *Please note that these are NOT "ADD-ONS" - we have included them into new reward tiers to reduce confusion! Please see the "Rewards" area for further information about how to get them!**
There is one flat price for worldwide shipping: 9 USD (except for Poland: 4 USD)  
The Game Mats are shipped separetly at a cost of 5,5 USD.  
You will be asked to pay for shipping after Kickstarter ends, from the Pledge Manager level.  
We are planning to start shipping games in the beginning of October. As we plan to attend the Spiel’17 convention in Essen, the game will be available to purchase there. There is a possibility that some backers will receive their games in December. We do not deliver your game; the shipping company does. Therefore, delivery times will vary according to your local postal service.
We expect to fulfill all rewards from within the EU, and as a result EU backers do not have to worry about customs or VAT 
Shipments to backers outside of the EU will have the most updated EUR-equivalent value for each pledge level declared as the value of the package. For example, 25 USD is currently 21 EUR. That's roughly an equivalent of 31,5 CAD / 31,5 AUD / 24 CHF / 2 754 JPY. Note that we can not be responsible for any customs fees. 
Tracking is not offered through this campaign. If tracking is important to you, please contact us via the KS messaging system before the campaign is over. 
Please note that we can not take any responsibility for any lost or damaged copies to Hungary, Russia, Asia, South America, Africa or Antarctica. 
We are confident the game we present to you is really good. Nevertheless, for your convenience we offer a satisfaction guarantee: a 100% return policy within 6 months counting from date of successful delivery, if you are not satisfied with the product. No questions asked. We will refund your full pledge amount, but we’ll ask you to cover the cost of sending the game back to us. 
Enchanters is a fantasy card drafting game. As an Enchanter you create an artifact and upgrade it each turn. Every card you take retains some of its power. As you grow stronger, you can take on more powerful monsters and, if you plan well, even defeat a dragon.
To setup a game just:
1. Give each player 5 crystals.
2. Shuffle the Kingdom decks (one per player) together.
3. Place 6 cards (Items and Enchantments only) on the Journey Track.
4. Choose a Village Card.
5. Pick the first player.
6. You're ready to play.
Players take turns to embark on quests: you collect cards from the Journey Track by paying with crystals. Cards go into two stacks: the Item Stack (here you put cards like “Long Sword”), and the Enchantment Stack (where you play titles, like “of Fire”). Combined, they create a “Long Sword of Fire”. The cards grant both temporary bonuses (upper icons and skills) and/or permanent ones (bottom icons).
Players may also attack approaching monsters and defeat them in a simple combat encounter to score points. In combat, you compare your Defense against the monster's Strength to determine whether you receive damage. Then, you need to accumulate as much Attack as the monster's Health to defeat it. You keep defeated cards as trophies.
From time to time, you rest in the village to gain crystals or heal wounds. If you do, discard the first card from the Journey Track.
At the end of each turn replenish the Journey Track to 6 cards.
The game ends when the last card is taken or discarded.
Want to know more? See Richard 'Rahdo' Ham play:
Here’s the rulebook:

Want to check out the Enchanters yourself? Just download, print and play. You’ll just need some tokens to count crystals and wounds. The decks you find inside are what you need to play a full game.

  While Enchanters was thoroughly tested, we always welcome your feedback. Feel free to make suggestions and ask questions in the comments section.
              First of all, Enchanters will not be published internationally without your help.  
We’re still a relatively small independent publishing house. In 2016, we designed and published the Enchanters in Poland (under the name Zaklinacze). 
While the Polish edition was well received, we are cannot wait to share the game with the rest of the world. We know the game is good, we’ve seen hundreds of players enjoy it - hardcore players and families alike. We had some time since the first run to make the game even better. We hope that reaching the stretch goals will allow us to show the Enchanters to the world in full glory.  
Other companies in Poland approached us with publishing deals, but we turned them down. We decided to stay independent, make a name for ourselves, maybe go full-time one day. You can help us make this dream come true.
Once the game is funded, you will be one of the first to get it (maybe with the exception of Essen attendees). Also, once the game goes to retail, we expect the price to go up from the $25 Kickstarter price – that depends on the stretch goals we manage to unlock.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As you see, we have very short delivery time. This begs a question, how do we do that?

1) Both graphic design of the game and illustrations on the cards are 90% ready, since the game had a first edition in Poland last year.

2) The production facility that we use (Trefl for cards, Mediagold for the rest) are located in our home cities. We worked together in the past and have booked their printing equipment ahead of time for this project.

3) Gindie publishing house, the business Jacek is the owner of, is making t-shirts and gadgets for polish webcomics. He has rich experience in shipping and proven crew working every day of the week. 

4) The Polish edition of Enchanters was also crowdfunded. That campaign taught us a lot. We don’t intend to repeat our mistakes.

5) Our professional background gave us skills to do this right. All of us are working in video game development - an industry that provides even more challenges than board games.

6) Last but not least, Ludi Creations, our partner in this endeavor, is a Kickstarter veteran. We’re in contact on daily basis.

When someone suggested I make an Itchy Feet-themed card game, I loved the idea but had no idea where to begin. Lucky for me, Canadian game designer, polyglot, traveler and all-around lovely human being Maxime Rioux (above left) volunteered his services. 
For more than a year and a half we've been brainstorming, designing, scrapping, re-designing, experimenting, tinkering and testing, testing, testing.
We started long distance (I live in Germany, Maxime in Quebec), using a half-defunct web-based software called Tabloro to fiddle and test, including many very fun sessions with Itchy Feet fans over Skype (thank you, friends!).

We wanted to create a game that was: 
Simple to learn
Interactive
Fun to replay again and again
Neither of us are huge gamers, so this was a high bar. It had to be something that we would love. With Itchy Feet: the Travel Game, we really believe we've succeeded. Our testers have been knocking our door down, wanting to keep playing. Everyone who's played it has been bowled over by its charm, simplicity, and good fun.
We really think you're going to enjoy it, too.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The game is finished and ready to go, so I'm confident we can make this happen. We are working with experienced manufacturers and fulfillment companies that have done Kickstarter card games many times before, so we've already figured out our production and shipping strategy.

I mean, all we're doing here is printing a deck of cards, so there's not much that can go wrong. But you never know, which is why I've kept our campaign as simple as possible. No complicated rewards, no overreaching stretch goals - just the game and a few bonuses that only rely on me to deliver. 

But that said this is my first card game and first Kickstarter campaign, so I'm learning a lot, and I'll probably make mistakes. Luckily I've got incredible support from colleagues who have already completed successful Kickstarter campaigns (looking at you, Awesome Shield and Amikumu), as well as the fantastic community out there that I've pestered so much with my questions and requests over the past year. 
 
But if you've got any questions or worries, please get in touch!

campaign.story:
Vindication Boardgame Intro from Blue Blazes, LLC on Vimeo.
VINDICATION (formerly Epoch: The Awakening) is a highly strategic tabletop board game for 2-5 players. The main mechanic is action selection with advanced resource management and an optional focus on area control. Game play generally takes 15-30 minutes per player.
The game was written and engineered over the course of several years by lifetime gamer, graphic designer, and branding consultant Marc Neidlinger, with the help of hundreds of play testers, artists, writers, and game enthusiasts.
Game Play Overview
The game begins: thrown overboard for a life of wretchedness, you wash ashore a hostile island ruins. Through advanced resource management, area control tactics, and freeform action selection, you’ll add companions to your party, acquire bizarre relics, attain potent character traits, and defeat a host of unusual monsters in the ultimate goal of mastering heroic attributes — and regaining honor.
You perform 3 actions on each turn in the order you feel is most advantageous that turn: activate a companion, travel to a new location, and interact with a map tile—taking advantage of a few free actions along the way. Many actions require the the use of your influence to gain attributes in a one-of-a-kind heroic attribute alchemy system, which is leveraged to gain the game's most powerful rewards. For example, you can meditate at a spire to gain inspiration. You can train at a fort to gain strength. But then you can combine your inspiration and strength to gain courage (inspired strength) which allows you to defeat monsters.
As you exert your influence to attain heroic attributes, build your party, and embark on your adventure, you'll find over 100 unique card abilities that can be merged in unusual ways to create potent combinations...only some of which will come out each game. The map is revealed fog-of-war style through tile placement, so it's different every game.
                            Unlocked via Social Stretch Goals!
      Downed in 3 days!!
            What are you wishing for, follower of the Light?
  Who's temple is this?
    80s Metal. You did it.
                    Believe. Just believe.

“This is such a great game, we don't give out a lot of approval stamps, I think the 4 of 5 of us who played rated the game 9.5 (which helps determine my over-all review and approval stamps). So much fun, I'm excited to play again the moment I have a spare day!”
"I had the chance to play this weekend and I think you have made a fantastic product top to bottom.” — John Z., Owner, Alderac Entertainment Group (AEG) and Producer of SmashUp, Love Letter, and Mystic Vale
“The game pushes players to adopt separate strategies, and adapt on the fly. Both victory points and the ending of the game are themselves gamified and interactable.” —Anthony P., Playtester
“The game has a nice mix of exploration, power combinations, and resource management…I think what I enjoy the most about Epoch is the way that you can choose your own path to regain honor—the game does not lock you into a particular path.” — Jonathan Liu, Senior Editor, GeekDad

ILLUSTRATION: Emiliano Cordoba, Phu Thieu, Shunskis, Duy Phan Nguyen Trinh, Reza Afshar, Inkary, Bartek Fedyczak, Brett Carville, Simon Tjong, Maria Gandolfo, Mat Sadler, Can Basdogan, Addison Rankin, Kyle Shold, Olie Boldador, Noemi Konkoly , Ryan J. Lowe.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are hitching our wagon to several time-tested groups to facilitate the most streamlined fulfillment process possible.

BACKERKIT: BackerKit is a crowdfunding-specific company focused on facilitating a smooth fulfillment process so that backers stay updated, are responded to quickly, and are valued as part of a larger community.

We started working with our manufacturer over a year ago, and have a detailed plan in place for execution. We've already approached the fulfillment companies for estimates and processes. We feel confident because we are using established fulfillment companies who have depth of experience specifically in the gaming industry.

While this is Orange Nebula's first crowdfunding project (as creators), we have been in business for over 4 years under this name, with a full-time staff of 5 plus half a dozen steady contractors. We have carefully prepared for this project, including high levels of communication with manufacturers, fulfillment companies, financial institutions, tax and legal specialists, and a handful of other vendors.

As you are reading this, 90% of the design production and high-res digital file preparation is already completed. As a creative agency, we are experts at file preparation and print production, so there will be no delays on our end in that regard. All of the files for the miniatures are already built and ready to rock.

In terms of fulfillment, there will undoubtedly be a few bumps along the way -- there always are a few -- but we are committed to doing the right thing even when nobody is looking. This is our reputation. Our vision is to make the gaming industry stronger and smarter, and it is our privilege to be a part of it all. We're very, very grateful.

campaign.story:
Miss the Kickstarter Campaign? Don't panic! Click the image to be automatically directed to where you can order Overworld!
  Overworld is a competitive tile-placement, territory control, and exploration board game for 2-4 Players with a 1-player Solo Quest Variant! It was designed by Nemo Rathwald for ages 14+ and plays in about 30 minutes. The most beautiful thing about Overworld is its elegance in simplicity; it takes only 5 minutes to teach but mastery will only develop after many, many plays.
If you enjoy games like...
Carcassonne
Alhambra
Takenoko
Tsuro
Then Overworld should especially resonate with you!
In Overworld, players act as explorers piecing together bit by bit the map of the Overworld by placing specially designed interlocking tiles drawn from a bag onto an expanding world map and adding your explorer tokens onto any new tile you explore. The interlocking teeth will only allow you to place your tiles in legal locations, making gameplay very smooth and easy to learn. "IF IT FITS, IT'S LEGIT!" 
Enclosed gaps will eventually form in the landscape, and in these gaps are where elusive Dungeons are discovered. Discover the Dungeons furthest apart from one another and control the most territory with your explorers riding Umbirds and Ships to win!
Overworld is the second installment of our Super Nano Enhanced Series, which began with Fire of Eidolon (shipping now worldwide!) This project will undergo several ENHANCEMENTS during the campaign which will upgrade the components and content of Overworld, and can be unlocked via Backer total Stretch Goals, Funding Stretch Goals, and Social Media goals, which will all be explained in detail below.
EVERY BACKER MAKES A DIFFERENCE! Overworld is mechanically like a Euro-game but is also highly thematic and heavily inspired by the 16-bit era of Role Playing and Adventure video games of the 1990's. It is visually stimulating and loaded with stylistic parody and in-jokes that fans of retro videogames will appreciate while still being accessible and wholly enjoyable by everyone all within a unique, original, and compelling game that stands entirely on its own. We started the Super Nano Enhanced Series with Fire of Eidolon and we continue the tradition as you explore that world in ages past...in Overworld!
Overworld came to Magic Meeple Games as a fully complete publish-ready game called Mirage which had been nearly published by another company before coming to us at Origins a couple years ago. We absolutely loved Mirage and saw an opportunity to re-theme the game to fit into our Super Nano Enhanced Series. With a new title and theme, Overworld has been under iteration and development for years and we feel it is finally ready for everyone to enjoy!
Easy to learn and teach, difficult to master, immersive theme, and a new board every time you play!
Here are some of the features you'll find in this game and in our Kickstarter campaign:
Great Gameplay! - High praise from reviewers, gamers, convention-goers of all ages for Overworld! 
High Replayability! - Overworld uses a brand new PUZZELOCK TILE SYSTEM and is never the same game twice! Procedurally generate the world as you play to make every game a brand new story!
High Accessibility! - Overworld uses a very simple set of rules has an extremely gentle learning curve and is extremely easy to pick up and play! The game can be taught in about FIVE MINUTES and after playing a few times will players begin to understand the depth that Overworld offers!
Backer-only Discounts! - After all Enhancements from this campaign, Overworld will have an MSRP of at least $35.99. Our Backers can get it right now for just $25 no matter how much content is added on through Enhancements and Stretch Goals! That's a savings of nearly $11 per copy!
ENHANCEMENTS! Stretch Goals! Achievements! - Your pledge WILL make the game better! Together we will make it awesome! Every backer matters!
Interactive Kickstarter campaign - Throughout the campaign we will make decisions about Enhancements and features based on the feedback YOU provide in our update polls! Leave your mark on tabletop gaming history!
Simplest Bundle Pricing on KickStarter! - Order as many copies of Overworld as you want at $25 each and pay shipping only for the first one! Just add $25 per extra copy and enter the total at the pledge confirmation screen. Boom. Done. No spreadsheets. No tricks.
Customer Support - It is our duty and honor to put your concerns at ease throughout the ENTIRE production process. Frequent updates during the campaign and no less than one update a month post-campaign until delivery. If you have a question or just want to say hello, reach out to us!
and now for something NEW:
MONEY-BACK SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - We're borrowing a page from Stonemaier Games and offering a Money-back guarantee with the Overworld project! Within one month of receiving Overworld, if you're unhappy with the product and customer service you've received, just send the game back to us and we'll issue a full refund of your original pledge!
Nemo Rathwald's Puzzelock Interlocking Tile Design solves the #1 problem with tile-placement games!
  Did you run out of play space? You can actually move this board and everything stays IN PLACE!
  Questions? We're here to help! We aim to have 24-hour or less response time to all inquiries during the campaign!
 
Super Nano Enhanced Series games undergo many ENHANCEMENTS throughout the campaign, many are achieved like normal Stretch Goals, but some are special and will require involvement in the comments or on social media!
Have a look at what we'e accomplished so far!
      Click the image to visit our Twitter page!
  And click HERE to visit our Facebook Page! 
  Measure the X/Y limits of your map and calculate your score much faster with this handy tool!
  Towns and Sidequests now part of the Overworld package!
  LINEN FINISH NOW INCLUDED!
  You asked for it, and we've been saving it for the epic finish! Can we reach this high?
    Your turn in Overworld is 4 simple steps: 
                                           Draw a Land Tile (from the bag) 
Attach it to another tile on the board (IF IT FITS, IT'S LEGIT!) 
Add Explorers to the Tile you added (one per segment, Umbirds for land, Ships for Sea) 
Resolve Gaps! (Check for Dungeon discoveries!)
Just how easy is it to play Overworld? Have a look!
The game will begin with a single Coastline Tile on the board. Begin your turn by drawing a Land Tile from the bag.
  You may choose to place the tile LAND side up or SEA side up, as long as there is a place to connect it where the teeth fit without obstruction. IF THE TEETH FIT, IT'S LEGIT!
  After placing a Land Tile, place three of your Explorer tokens on it, Umbird tokens explore LAND, and Ship tokens explore SEA. Each player gets seven of both to Explore the Overworld!
  Yellow's turn is over, play continues in this way as Red and White each get a turn...until a gap is created into which no other tile can fit, then a Dungeon is discovered!
  Dungeons are Discovered by counting up all of the Explorer tokens belonging to each player in all regions connected ORTHOGONALLY to the gap. Yellow has the most Explorers connected to this gap and gets to claim the Dungeon discovery.
Explorer tokens (Umbirds or Ships) that are used to Discover a Dungeon (i.e. those belonging to the player that had the most and placed their dungeon door in the gap) are returned to that player to be used again, the others stay on the board!
Take note that player White placed the tile that gave player Yellow that Dungeon! This is a very important tactic that you will need to deprive your opponents of territory!
If there is a tie, the player who placed the tile gets to decide who breaks the tie and gets the Dungeon Discovery. 
Play continues until no more tiles remain in the bag, then scoring begins.
END OF GAME
You collect points for the Explorer tokens you still have in play, and the total distance of the shortest path (in Orthogonal spaces) around all of your Dungeon doors in play, door-to-door-to-door. Like this:
  Click here to see the complete End Game scoring ruleset!

This list will change and evolve as we unlock Stretch Goals and add Enhancements!

32x PUZZELOCK Land Tiles - Double-sided and Die-cut with our special Puzzelock design that physically prevents invalid tile placement. "IF IT FITS, IT'S LEGIT!"
28x Umbird Tokens - Basic funding goal will make chipboard tokens, Enhancement goals will make them laser cut meeples!
28x Ship Tokens - Basic funding goal will make chipboard tokens, Enhancement goals will make them laser cut meeples!
12x Dungeon Door Tokens - Basic funding goal will make chipboard tokens, Enhancement goals will make them laser cut meeples!
4x Quick-Reference/Faction Cards - Poker-Sized Cards - Never forget a rule or which color belongs to which player with these handy Quick-Reference/Faction cards! THANK YOU TO OUR DAY-1 BACKERS!
1x Tile Bag - For randomization of tiles, through Enhancement goals, this could become a luxurious drawstring cloth bag with an embroidered design!
Extra Zip-Lock Baggies - To carry everything and keep it organized!
EXPANSION CONTENT PLANNED - To be revealed via Stretch Goal Enhancements. Planned content includes: Solo play and more than one Mini-Expansion!
BONUS! Every copy of Overworld sold here will include an exclusive promo for our previous project, Fire of Eidolon! Thank you to all of the backers that helped us get here today!!

Some of these Enhancements will behave like traditional Stretch Goals which most are familiar with, but some will be different and put more focus on Backer Participation.

The best thing you can do to help improve Overworld is to back our project. The SECOND best thing you can do to help Overworld is to spread the word and share our campaign on all of your favorite Social Media sites! Here are some fun social media avatars you can use to help express your fandom! Collect them all!

Add $25 to your Pledge for each extra copy if our built-in Pledge levels do not suit your needs. We will discount every pledge down to charging shipping on only the first copy of Overworld in each order!*
Rewards for this project will be shipped primarily from the USA. Distributor/Manufacturer may collaboratively ship some rewards from other countries to save on shipping and customs costs. For the Fire of Eidolon project, we ultimately opted for a combination effort using Amazon and SFC (Ship from China) as many highly successful Kickstarter projects have done and the results have been favorable!
Rather than lock ourselves in to a specific method of shipping, we analyze the order distribution at the time of manufacturing to find the most cost-effective and time-effective distribution options available to us. This is our commitment to you in our goal for constant process-improvement and to provide the best possible products that we can!

Residents of Brazil, Russia, and South America take note: to ensure your package is delivered, additional charges may be required to ensure delivery verification in certain regions of these countries. If these additional charges are not paid, the chances of lost packages in those regions increases sharply and our distributor is attempting to implement solutions to this problem. If you reside in any of these countries please inquire about your pledge before the end of the campaign as the $20 basic shipping charge cannot guarantee delivery in these countries. 
Regarding Customs: Our shipping partners offers what they call "Customs-Friendly Worldwide Shipping" meaning they coordinate all transport, customs clearance, and brokerage from the factory to the destination using shipping depots all around the world. They have already laid the groundwork to ensure all packages will make it to backers in every country as smoothly and inexpensively as possible. If any VAT taxes or customs fees would apply to your order, we make sure those are pre-paid to make it easier for YOU! 
While we cannot personally guarantee that no single person will have any customs difficulties on an individual level, we are confident in our ability to mitigate any potential issues and keep surprise costs far away from our backers and their ability to make it right should any such problems arise. We have had very few individual cases of customs difficulties and the processes have improved even more since those challenges have occurred. If all of our efforts still do not meet your expectations, you are still protected by our Money-Back guarantee! Pledge with Confidence!
Delivering your reward responsibly
Our primary goal and responsibility as Magic Meeple Games is to deliver the rewards that our backers pledge for, at the level of quality they expect, and as quickly as possible. Magic Meeple Games and its partners have years of collective experience overseeing planning and production to ensure Overworld well be delivered to all backers in a timely manner. 
So far, Magic Meeple Games has produced and shipped two feature projects. Darkrock Ventures, which has fully fulfilled; and Fire of Eidolon which has been partially fulfilled already and will complete fulfillment before this Kickstarter campaign is complete.
We have run into slight speedbumps with each of these projects which hinged on the final completion of graphics. We can be proud of the fact the amount of delay was reduced dramatically with the fulfillment of FoE as compared to DRV, but we can do better. This time, we have a fully graphic-designed rulebook completed IN ADVANCE for everyone to enjoy which means we won't be waiting on it before manufacturing. This project focuses on the physical components of the game and less on artwork, this will also help us accelerate our manufacturing process and get the game made that much faster.
In fact, it is our goal to enter manufacturing on this project by October, and ALREADY have prepared art, graphics, and rules all in advance to make this a realistic goal. We are challenging ourselves to make Overworld our best-record for delivery, we have laid out even more groundwork ahead of time and together we can make this possible! Thank you for your support!
We do not plan to use use the built-in survey system for the Overworld Campaign, after the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will use PledgeManager to manage your orders and give everyone one last opportunity to add on to their pledge.     Seven hundred playtests. Two laser cutters. Twelve BoardGameGeekGold. Six Pez dispensers. The heat of a thousand suns. Boardgame designer Nemo Rathwald has most of these things. 
Nemo's game design goals are:  
Interesting choices
Little downtime
Lots of gameplay from as few rules as possible 
Multiple viable paths to victory 
Components that physically don't let you break rules, so you don't have to remember them.
Nemo started searching the shelves for boardgames which turned out to only exist in his imagination. So he started making them so he could play them. He got into game design in 2003, at the first Penguicon (a convention of all geeky interests) and has been helping to run the convention ever since, where he playtests new board games of his own design every year.
In 2010, Nemo discovered i3Detroit hackerspace, a nonprofit community workshop with an educational mission in art and technology, where he volunteers as a Board Director, an Officer, and an Instructor. There, he upgraded his ability to make lavish show-stopping board game prototypes. Due to his experience in publishing, he fully illustrates and preps his games and rulebooks for pre-press in advance. In 2013 he changed careers from graphic design to web development. In 2014 he signed his first board game publishing contract at Protospiel, a convention for board game designers. 
Nemo Rathwald carries a wheeled suitcase of board games in the trunk of his car at all times.
Here is an unboxing video of our last production, Fire of Eidolon, so you can see the standard of quality we aim for with our projects!
Magic Meeple Games, LLC. is a tabletop publishing company based in Phoenix, Arizona. By gamers, for gamers, we are Magic Meeple the Boardgame People! 
Founded, co-owned, and operated by a husband/wife team; We are passionate, lifelong tabletop gamers and we want to show that passion through the games we choose to design, develop, and publish. In our first campaign, Gamelyn Games partnered with us to elevate Magic Meeple Games to their level of quality and customer satisfaction straight out of the gate and we upheld that standard as we moved forward with our first solo campaign, Fire of Eidolon! Now we return for our THIRD Kickstarter project with hopefully many more to come.
Magic Meeple Games origins began in the industry in 2007 through independent game design, company co-owner Ian Stedman is a published designer himself and has worked on several projects for several other publishing companies as a consultant and designed Magnum Opus for Clever Mojo Games. 
This is the third core entry into our publishing catalog, and we drawn from the experience of designers, developers, publishers, distributors, manufacturers, and retailers all over the world. We would not ask for your pledges if we were not confident in our ability to fulfill the obligations we have set forth for ourselves. We have worked hard to hone our craft and learn everything necessary to produce quality games at competitive prices and at last we have the tools we need to do so. Now, we need your help to make it all real! Our customers are our #1 focus and we are honor-bound to provide the most friendly & prompt service and communication we possibly can. 
Please do not hesitate to contact us on Twitter @MagicMeeple, find us on Facebook.com/MagicMeepleGames, send us message directly on Kickstarter, or you can even email me directly at ian@magicmeeplegames.com!  
You can learn more about Magic Meeple Games HERE.  
Most of all, we want to thank each and every one of your for your belief and support in this project! Please share it with your friends and family, spread the word!  
 All the Best,

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game like Overworld is a complicated, time consuming, and expensive process. It is prone to many surprises and problems, even for experienced publishers. 

Fortunately our team is comprised of exceptionally experienced and talented individuals, with years of expertise in Game Design, Game Development, Print Publishing, Product Manufacturing, Project Fulfillment, Art, Technical Documentation, Retailer Support, Retail & Online Sales, Technology Support, Retail sales, and Graphics Design.

We co-published our first project, Darkrock Ventures, with the collaboration of the exceptionally experienced Gamelyn Games, and that project was a SUCCESS. Our first solo project, Fire of Eidolon was also a SUCCESS. We at Magic Meeple Games are proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have even more experience and knowledge in our corner with successful fulfillment of board game projects.

Our previous project fell a couple months short of our target Shipping date, and we have identified several contributing factors to that delay and have actively made improvements in our process to prevent the likelihood of such delays happening again.

For this project, we are focusing on a game which came to us very much complete. Additional features have been added and small tweaks have been made here and there, but suffice to say, the game is already finished and manufacturing-ready. All that is left is to put in the add-on content that is unlocked in the campaign, update the already designed fully-graphical rulebook (something that has been a challenge in the past) and send off the files. We have never been in a better position to go straight-to-print.

We are also expanding our horizons as we seek manufacturing and distribution, we are adapting to find better solutions to save time and money, this began by working with Discover Gaming Fulfillment with the distribution of Fire of Eidolon. Thanks to them, most of our backers have already gotten their rewards!

During the manufacturing of Darkrock Ventures there was a technology failure that caused a delay that we could not control. This is just an example as things such as this cannot be helped no matter how prepared you may be. No project is immune to the possible mishap, but this road is familiar to us, our distributors, and our manufacturers and we are confident in our ability to deliver our products to our backers and fans. 

Thank you for your confidence and support!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Above all, We are 100% dedicated to customer service and backer communication. We will be transparent with our process, and involve our backers as much as possible.

We will be present DAILY during the project to answer any questions or read any comments and we will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress when possible.

Thank you for your trust in us! We couldn't do it without you! Look what we accomplished together with DRV and FoE! Let's bring Overworld to the gaming world, too!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

campaign.story:
Sir Marcus and his trusty steed Atticus
Oh Bollocks! The Queen's tyranny is spreading into every corner of the kingdom. Her foot soldiers scour the countryside to hunt the behemoth―a bewitched creature that was once her husband. Your small band of rebels will need sharp wits and a bit of luck to save the King and reclaim the land's virtue.
The Queen's Army is the highly anticipated solo variant expansion for the game Feudum, allowing you (and others) to play against an A.I. player! The elegantly crafted automa deck was developed in collaboration with J.R. Honeycutt (developer for Tesla vs Edison: Powering Up!) and Brian Neff. The game rewards wise resource management and requires cunning play to keep the queen's army at bay as it tries to thwart your rise to power!
Additionally, The Queen's Army is being localized in Germany with help from our friends at Spielschmiede! They will handle the german translation upon reaching their crowdfunding goal. All funding raised on Spieleschmiede will count towards unlocking stretch goals here!
Feudum: The Queen's Army features a keenly designed A.I. player that cleverly reacts to game conditions and keeps you guessing with her unpredictable maneuvering.  Rounds are played just like the base game with alternating turns, round by round until each epoch is triggered. However, the Queen is less restrained by resource or route requirements making her a powerful force to reckon with! Players may face the Queen alone, or cooperate to defeat her (while still competing for the highest individual score).
The game's solo play is streamlined and elegant like the automa mechanics found in games such as Between Two Cities, Alhambra, Viticulture and Scythe. After countless play tests, developer Brian Neff concluded in the Queen's Army Development Journal that the game is an "incredibly in-depth, challenging and fun experience."
English Available Now
Solo Variant Preview: Developer J.R. delivers a rousing single round run-through of the Queen's Army.
Base Game Complete Rules:Here is a wonderfully crafted animation of the entire rules with subtitles (cc) in English, German, Italian, Spanish (Spain), Spanish (LaAm), Dutch and Greek.
Intricately crafted pawns and a majestic horse
Feudum: The Queen's Army will feature meticulously-crafted components designed by award-winning artist Justin Schultz. Here's what you'll find:
50 automa cards featuring easy-to-follow iconography

1 fate die that determines the Queen's destiny
1 resin horse named Atticus

With extra difficulty settings, you can even tune your own experience! The Queen's Army has been a pleasure to work on, and I'll be adding it to my collection, even with close to two dozen games under my belt." —Developer Brian Neff of Waitress Games

"I fought against the Queen’s Army at Geekway—a riveting tale of intrigue, certain death, and a harrowing escape! Leading a solo rebellion against the Queen and rising above her tyranny—is a most gratifying quest for prestige and honor!" — Aaron Martell, Playtester Extraordinaire

Retailers choosing the retailer reward will receive access to retail pricing on add ons (base game, expansions, etc.) after the campaign. Please contact Mark Swanson at mark@oddbirdgames.com with any questions.
Feudum localization, co-development, production, fulfillment and distribution will be handled by amazing companies around the world. Thank you Tien Vu Do (Spieleschmiede), J.R. Honeycutt (Restoration Games and Waitress Games), Brian Neff (Waitress Games), Seth Grier (Quartermaster Logistics), Sean Tilley (BackerKit), Michael Lee and David Lipman (Panda), Justin Bergeron and Christina Suen (OTX), Andrew Lum (Aetherworks in Australia), Aldo Ghiozzi (Impressions) and Tracy Dou and Hanna Zou (SFC in China) and Tommy Hong (Meeple Realty).
Justin Schultz & Mark Swanson
Game Designer
Professor by day and game designer by night, I live in Columbia, Missouri with my three splendid daughters. I was Inspired by Eurostyle games in the late 90s and became a fan of legends like Reiner Knizia, Klaus Teuber, Martin Wallace and Andreas Seyfarth. I unveiled my prototype of Feudum at GenCon 2014 and was thrilled to meet and gain insight from folks like Eric Lang, Mike Eliott, Bruno Faidutti and Jamey Stegmaier. I am grateful for Feudum's wonderful reception back in November of 2016 and thrilled by its ever growing community. Check out facebook.com/feudum  or BoardGameGeek to learn more. 
Artist
As he likes to put it, Justin Schultz is an "earthling living in Jackson, Mississippi." Justin studied graphic design at Mississippi State University and worked for a number of advertising agencies before focusing on concert posters, album covers, package design and, just recently, board game art! His distinctive style of populating his art with monsters, reptiles and robots conjures up memories of children's picture books, albeit slightly skewed. Justin explains that he likes to lure viewers in with "superficially charming images," but then reveal something more "heartbreaking" or "daunting" upon closer inspection.  In 2010, Justin started his independent studio, The Flying Chair.
J.R. Honeycutt & Brian Neff
J.R. Honeycutt, Developer
JR Honeycutt is a game designer and developer. He works with Rob and Lindsay Daviau in their game design studio, and is the Tinker-in-Chief at Restoration Games.
JR's work includes development on Legacy games SeaFall and Charterstone, and on multiple titles during his time with Artana. Through his design studio, Waitress Games, JR has designed or co-designed multiple board, card, and role playing games like Food Truck Destruction Derby (9th Level Games), Unpub: The Unpublished Card Game (Greater than Games/Dice Hate Me), and the Fantasy Fantasy Sports series (CSE Games).
JR lives in Texas with his wife, Amy, and their two cats Buck and Dixie. He spends most of his time squinting at Google documents.
Brian Neff, Developer
Brian Fightmaster Neff (that's his legal middle name) is known for having 1,000 indie RPGs in his mind. He's the MacGyver of storytelling games, which means you can give him a piece of string and a hammer and he'll give you an award-winning tabletop game.
Brian is the brain of Waitress Games, He Craves efficiency in all his gaming, and regularly reminds us of the hidden player experience a game could unleash
He's also the designer of Food Truck Destruction Derby, and Hot 16: A Game of Dope Rhymes. Little known fact: Brian has an infinite supply of notecards.
Odd Bird Games is partnered with Quartermaster Logistics to get you your rewards! They are powered by CoolStuffInc.com, a business that has been shipping games for over 14 years to customers around the world. Quartermaster Logistics will ensure your packages arrive safe and on time as every game is professionally packed and protected.
How it Works
A short time after the campaign is over, you will receive an email from Backerkit that directs you to a pledge manager where you can confirm or upgrade your pledge, and add base games, expansions or other “add-ons.” (PayPal accepted). 

Your Shipping will be automatically calculated at that time based on the total weight of your order. (Backerkit has automated this, so it is a lot easier now!)  Note: Rewards from the previous Kickstarter campaign may NOT be delayed to ship with this campaign. Each campaign is on an independent fulfillment schedule.
Backerkit turns overpledges into a credit that may be used as you see fit in the pledge manager.   
Shipping Estimates 
The rates below are good faith 2018 ESTIMATES of carrier rates (FedEx, UPS) plus freight. (Carriers update pricing in January by as much as 4%, so I was advised to add 4% to current rates to be on the safe side). campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With one successful Kickstarter campaign under our belts, the rough waters of fulfillment houses, freight shippers, manufacturers and backer relations....have turned to calmer seas!

Of course, we don't take full credit for navigating this ship! We continue to receive generous support from seasoned game designers and key partners in the game industry. We consider them "shipmates."

Our reliable shipmates from the Spieleschmiede translated the base game into German, and endeavor to do the same for the Queen's Army provided they reach their crowdfunding goal. The localization team at Spieleschmiede specializes in German-edition translations and are committed to the highest standards.

Meanwhile, Backerkit will continue to facilitate backer orders with a new and improved system; OTX will ensure that freight shipping goes off without a hitch; and QM Logisitcs will permit our games to ship from within backers' countries of origin. These partnerships will always be marked by transparency and free-flowing communication!

Not too long ago, Odd Bird Games was a methane gas-sniffing canary trapped deep within the bowels of a coal mine. But, by good fortune, we escaped up the shaft towards the light. And now, we are fiercely fluttering toward the heavens.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
