Welcome dear Battalians!
Last year we introduced our board game Battalia: The Creation to the Kickstarter community, and after a very emotional and successful campaign we delivered on time a top quality product to our backers, without any compromise. The game gained a lot of popularity, and got high average rating on BGG. We are proud to have the most dedicated supporters and here we want to thank everyone of them for their enthusiasm and effort to help us in our journey. And after the first challenge is completed, we are ready for the next adventure. 
We are happy to announce our first BIG! Expansion for Battalia the Creation. Here you will have the opportunity to get your copy of Battalia: The Stormgates, Crowdfunding Edition (CEdition). For newcomers in our universe there is a second chance to lay hands on the base game Battalia: The Creation, Crowdfunding edition or directly on a big combo package including both of them :) .
  Important note: NO RETAIL version of the Stormgates CEdition expansion box is scheduled for next year and in our general plans. For now we prefer to work only for the Kickstarter community due to many meaningful reasons and the only one not to call the whole box officially Kickstarter exclusive is that we will distribute some minor quantities of games to some loyal retailers due to the round up needed to produce a reasonable number of this edition in the planned print run. Those will be only insignificant numbers and for sure it will be very unlikely to distribute them overseas due to some logistic and other issues.
REAL SHOT 1 - BASIC 4 PLAYER GAME
  REAL SHOT 2 - COMMON CARD POOL AND SUN ORACLE
  REAL SHOT 3 - LARGE MINIATURES FROM THE BASIC SET
  REAL SHOT 4 - THE PAINTED VERSION (delivered unpainted)
  REAL SHOT 5 - PAINTED MINIS IN ACTION
  REAL SHOT 6 - COLORFUL IDEAS FOR YOUR IMAGINATION
  The game concept
BATTALIA: The Creation is a medium weight strategy game for 2-4 players, ages 13 and up. It combines the mechanics of map construction, deck building, hero and area control and neat calendar mechanics. 
In this game of creation and conquest the players will send their heroes on an epic journey to explore new territories and take control over neutral or enemy cities. They will hire battle units, and acquire useful artefacts, with the greater goal to create mighty nations and unbeatable armies. Every player will construct roads to gain access to new map areas and will build or upgrade cities, in order to expand his domain and to earn victory points. Battalia: The Creation can be won through intensive development and growth of your own city system, or through aggressive play of war and conquer, capturing opponents settlements.
Base Game Features:  
Language independent  
Basic game mode  
Advanced game mode for experienced players   
Alternative game scenario - The Bleading horn of destiny.  
Modular map, built during the game   
Highly detailed big scale miniatures   
Unique calendar mechanics   
Unique cards purchase mechanics
The game rules are available in 15 languages. Click on the flags to navigate to the rules section on our website.
  If you want to check our previous campaign, click on the logo below: 
  You can try the demo of the game on Tabletopia.com. The website doesn't support all browsers, so you need to use Mozilla or Internet explorer. You will also need to install Unity Web Player. Click on the image below to navigate to the game.
  Find more information on battalia.eu: rulebooks and reviews, discussion forum and interesting details about the whole Battalia universe! 
The home page for the whole Battalia universe...
   The expansion
The expansion Battalia: The Stormgates includes the following new features:
Components for 5th and 6th player.
Team play - shortens the downtime and makes the game even more dynamic. Brings new strategies for the players.
King and Queen cards - units with higher battle strength, capable of upgrading your level 4 cities.
Capitals and royal residences - cities with higher defensive strength, giving more victory points.
Stormgates - portals which transport your heroes to distant locations on the map.
Stormevents - adventure element in the game. Different effects triggered when heroes pass through a Stormgate. 
Metamorpha - character with big impact on the game. Provides a lot of new opportunities for development, depending on the terrain it stands on. Speeds up the game flow.
Bilkarr O'The mountain people - another character, providing new strategies. Herbalist, travelling around the world, selling special potions. All potions have different effect, which boosts the players' powers.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not our first rodeo, ok it's our second :) ... But just take a look at our first campaign and the feedback after it and after delivery... I would say that nobody could complain about what we've shipped as a final product. Despites some small delivery difficulties in the horror "just before Christmas period of the year", everything else went well and on time. All backers received their products in less than 6 months after campaign's end. The game itself was produced in Germany covering highest manufacturing standards and the quality of all miniatures and materials is just awesome. 
About the gameplay you can read all over the internet, but here a short list with reviews and other worthy stuff on our home page: http://battalia.eu/reviews/ - it speaks for itself. 
I would add only that our average BGG rating for the basic game is about 8.0 (or more) since the beginning...

On one hand we are just a small company and this is our second Kickstarter project, but on the other we have been publishing board games for the past six years now. We are cooperating with more than 30 famous publishers like FFG, KOSMOS, Hans im Glueck, AMIGO, IELLO and others. During this time we have published Bulgarian localized editions of many worldwide popular board games such as “Game Of Thrones: The Board Game”, “Sid Meier’s Civilization”, “The Legends Of Andor”, “Ubongo”, “Carcassonne”, “Wizard”, “Atlantis”, “ King Of Tokyo”, etc… This means a lot of EXPERIENCE on our end! Our production sites are located mainly in Germany, US and China, so international logistics are not an obstacle for us and meanwhile we know very well how to play the “big game” called PUBLISHING. 
Please note: the estimated delivery date is June 2017, but please keep in mind that this is only an informed guess. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We will do our best to minimize this as much as possible, but if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all, we are always ready to refund pledges in full. 
Of course, there are risks with every project, but we hope that our track record in publishing and our commitment to do everything as good as possible will gain your trust in us.
Production shipping or customs delays are always possible, but since our game is 90% complete, a small delay is probably the worst thing that could occur on this project. The most sophisticated part of our project is probably the production of the Battalia heroes and NPCs. Yes, exactly – these large and beautiful, but really complicated for production figurines. They are expensive, the process takes a lot of time and commitment, but the result is really worth the effort. To ensure a smooth and accurate production and delivery, we are cooperating with an old partner who is among the best production factories in Germany - a renown specialist in the board game field with really high quality standards for everything they produce – miniatures, game material, game board, boxes and so on…. They produce also for CMoN and many other renown publishers. This should put everyone's minds at ease, regarding quality and delivery schedule! 
We have no reason to expect that something could go terribly wrong, but in case that this happens, please check our refund policy.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, charges included, NO QUESTIONS ASKED. After this period a refund without any explanation is still possible, though that’s minus Kickstarter and Stripe payment processing fees (as we will not be refunded by them after this 60 day period). 
However, once we’ve begun packaging and preparing your rewards for shipment (usually 8 weeks before the actual shipping date), refunds are no longer possible. This means that we will reject any refunds after end of March 2017. 
Important: If a game or component cannot be delivered at all (which is very unlikely), at your wish we will refund you the full amount, including fees, or we will try to work with you per e-mail and find a satisfactory solution for your individual case. 
Please note: All refunds requested during the original 60 day period are returned to your credit card via Stripe. Refunds requested after this period will be processed via PayPal only!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
GLITCHED is a mystery and exploration RPG coming to PC, Mac, and Linux. The game features traditional turn-based combat with a little bit of spice but will primarily focus on the story and how you change it. This will be done through the ESSENCE SYSTEM, which will track a player's personality and morality. After a glitch appears in the world of SOREN, our unexpected hero, Gus, will become aware of you- the player. Experience fourth wall breaking shenanigans while making decisions that will shape this world. 
We are funded!
Thanks to all of our backers! GLITCHED is now funded and will begin development as soon as the Kickstarter is over! 
If you cannot back through Kickstarter, use our Paypal to pre-order GLITCHED. You'll be able to pre-order GLITCHED for $10 and have the option for a few of our backer rewards as well. This will go down once our Kickstarter campaign is over! But be aware that any money given via Paypal will not reflect on the Kickstarter page total.
If you haven't backed us yet, check out our stretch goals to help add content to GLITCHED! 
   GLITCHED is being developed by En House Studios, a Chicago-based game dev team. Instead of wasting your time reading this introduction paragraph, you could be playing a demo of GLITCHED now.
(Like right now.)
     NOTE: This is a demo prototype of the game. It reflects an early development cycle and you can expect changes and improvements to a final version. This version will have some bugs which we will work to fix as soon as possible. We recommend 2 GB of free ram in order to run GLITCHED. A Linux version will be available for the final release only, sorry!
  The small town of BETWIXT sits far removed from the events of the rest of the world and has always been home to GUS, our unlikely hero. 
Things remained ever constant until one day his best friend, CONRAD, told him he was going to leave for strange reasons.
On the night before CONRAD departs, an unexplained phenomenon, the glitch, seemingly erases his existence from the world. After coming face to face with the glitch, GUS is able to interact and speak to you- the player of GLITCHED. The traumatic event of suddenly losing his friend significantly affects GUS, but luckily you’ll be there to guide him through.
Together, you and GUS will explore the world of SOREN and discover the truth behind it all. Each choice you make might influence who decides to be your friend or foe   
You’ll travel from crowded cities to ancient kingdoms. Remnants and tales of the past will lead you to the answers of the present.
You're bound to meet plenty of strange characters on your journey. Some will be friends and other foes- perhaps that choice is left up to you.
  At its core, GLITCHED is a story driven RPG where the player is constantly making decisions that have an impact of the world of SOREN. 
In GLITCHED, the ESSENCE SYSTEM will track a player's choices and shape their personality and morality. This system will give each player a unique experience. 
By exploring the world in your own way, you’ll generate points towards six different ESSENCE alignments. 
These alignments serve as personality types which will impact characters, story and the world around you. Your interaction with NPCs, how you explore the environment, combat, and even your conversations with GUS will determine your ESSENCE.   
Each ESSENCE focuses on certain character traits and ideologies. No ESSENCE is good or evil, but instead explains the reasons behind your actions. Through meeting and talking to different NPCs, you’ll get a better idea of what each ESSENCE is about. 
  GLITCHED uses traditional turn based combat with a few twists:
There is no leveling or random monster encounters.
All combat is story based and players will be making choices that may or may not lead to a brawl.
Leveling up and experience are also removed. 
Players will have to use different party members and equipment in order to change how they approach each battle.
Deciding to kill, spare, or find another way to stop a fight will all lead to different story outcomes.
Actions in battle are limited to three types: Fighting, Interacting, & Goodies. When enemies cannot fight anymore you'll be able to choose to kill or spare them which will alter the story. 
You might also choose to interact with your enemy to resolve the conflict in a different way . Lastly, you'll be able to use items in battle to bring about various effects.
Check out our stretch goals section to see possible additions to the features of GLITCHED. There are plenty of things to be added, but prioritizing main game play features in the demo means smaller additions did not find their way in.
  The soundtrack for GLITCHED features music composed by our very own Justin Hilton. Our friend Stijn Van Wakeren also composed a few songs and produced all of the tracks for the demo. Check out more of his work here. Visit the GLITCHED Soundcloud for more tracks here or check out the Band Camp to purchase some of the songs here.
                                                               Forget Me Not
                                                                  Kinda Lost
                                                            Slick Like Green Skin
                                                     Composed by Stijn Van Wakeren
                                                                  Safe & Sound
                                   We kept backer rewards as simple as possible. Each tier includes all previous rewards. The early bird special includes the full game, the soundtrack, and the dev book for $10 but is only for the first 75 backers.
                                          ⋆ STRETCH GOALS ⋆
  Customize a hub town! You’ll be able to pick and choose the layout, buildings, and residents. A quiet (or noisy) place for you and your friends to kick back.
Bebo's are our lovable flightless birds. As a species, they are quite infatuated with Gus. As you traverse the world, you’ll run into all different sorts of them. As any good RPG would have you do: it’s time to collect them all.
Put your number crunching to the test against a series of turn based combat trials. You’ll be able to build an arcade in your hub town which will include boss rush modes, new game play, and more.
Our pixel portraits for each character could use a little love, and with this stretch goal you’ll get two upgrades for the price of one. First, each character will get a nice little talking animation to go along with their speech. Second, each character will get a full sheet of emotions to help bring conversations to life just a bit more. 
Let’s get those enemy sprites movin’ and groovin’. With this stretch goal we’ll add enemy animations along with some animation to the character cards for your allies. Making the battles just a bit more lively might help during some of those longer encounters.
This stretch goal will encompass quite a lot of content. We can’t give away too many details about additions to the game, but you can expect more hours of game play at this stretch goal. This will add things like new places to explore, new quests and characters, new equipment, and more branching stories. At this funding level, we’ll be able to create our ‘dream game’ without leaving content out that we really wished to see in the full release.
GLITCHED already has tons of replay-ability with the Essence System, but with New Game+ you will challenge tougher enemies, uncover hidden secrets, and more to reward players who want to experience everything. More details will come once it's unlocked! 
The friendship system will allow your party members to interact with one another. They will gain points being in the party together and learn tag skills in battle. More character backstory and cool skills await with the friendship system!
New quests and characters come along with the day and night system. You'll be able to wait or use an inn to cycle the time of day. Different quests and characters will be available during different parts of the day. More secrets and complex quests!
Play GLITCHED on PS Vita! All $10+ backers will get a choice of which platform they would like to receive their copy of GLITCHED on.
Play GLITCHED on PS3 and PS4! All $10+ backers will get a choice of which platform they would like to receive their copy of GLITCHED on.
Play GLITCHED on XBOX One! All $10+ backers will get a choice of which platform they would like to receive their copy of GLITCHED on.
With this stretch goal, all backers will receive free additional content after release. The nature of the DLC we want to keep hidden to avoid spoilers, in total there will be an additional 10-25 hours of content with this stretch goal- free to all backers!
  Play GLITCHED on your 3DS! All $10+ backers will get a choice of which platform they would like to receive their copy of GLITCHED on. 
En House Studios is a Chicago based game dev team. While the team is small, we are completely dedicated to this project. Through the demo, we hope to showcase our ability to fully develop GLITCHED. En House Studios LLC is an established limited liability company. 
All funds earned through Kickstarter will be put directly into the company and go towards the development of GLITCHED. Funding allocation can be seen below in the money section.
TUMBLR | TWITTER | FACEBOOK | RPGMaker.net | Itch.io | Press Kit | Steam GREENLIGHT
    ZACK - Programmer  |  JUSTIN - Composer & Designer | NIKKO - Lead Designer & Artist 
Our friends:
Anthony Luna (Enemy/Faces Pixel Art) 
Stijn Van Wakeren (Soundtrack Production) 
Lou H.
If you have any questions, get in contact with us through Kickstarter or social media. We’ll make a video of us answering questions we get!
  Let’s talk cash. The reason we are here on Kickstarter is because we need more than our personal funds to fully develop GLITCHED. Above, you’ll see the breakdown plan of our spending. A sizable chunk will go to backer rewards. Our development costs can be seen by adding art, soundtrack, licensing, and graphic design together. These all add up to fifty percent of the total. Art will go towards paying our pixel artists and promotional artists. Soundtrack will go towards producing our compositions. Kickstarter fees and taxes will take about ten percent. What’s left will be spent on promotion which gets us to our full budget.   
This budget changes in the event that we earn more than our asking amount. We’ll update this little pie chart if that does happen to keep you informed on where your money will be going. We wish to be transparent on how we will use these funds and will answer ANY possible question you have about spending. We take development costs very seriously and believe open communication is important to crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter is a risk. What we have tried to do is showcase not only our serious dedication to the project, but also that we have the skills, means, and environment to develop GLITCHED. We hope that our Kickstarter and demo has provided you enough confidence to consider backing us.

With that said, game development has its risks. There are everyday risks such as health, family, and life issues that might happen to anyone. Development risks are where most problems arise. For us, this means extended deadlines, delayed development, or the feared "running out of funds." We have taken a look at the necessities for GLITCHED and have carefully based our budget around that. With more money behind the project comes more security, content, and quality. Our main goal is to deliver GLITCHED. We have estimated a release date of February 2018 but the stated risks could possibly change that.

We have laid out our case in this Kickstarter. We have the ability to produce GLITCHED and our demo shows a taste of what the final product will look like. We hope you understand the risks that might happen down the road but also take a look at what we have done to earn your trust in us. We believe greatly in transparency and there will be nothing that happens in development which we don't relay to you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings,  
As we close this project, now is the time to check in with everyone to ensure that you received your items or a refund. Some backers had their items returned to us and we are making arrangements to have them shipped out again so you would likely know if that is your case. If you have not received your items at this point or a notice of a return/shipment, let us know by a message or a form(preferred). If you have already submitted a form there is no need to do it again; however, do look out for a message from us in case something needs to be cleared up.  Some packages are having customs issues so we will check on that when forms are submitted.

Greetings,
Just a quick note to let you know where we are in the shipping process.  As stated in the last update, a large batch of inventory was sent from TN to VA so we can ship them faster.  The shipment took 7 days rather than 2 to get here.  Half the coins needed to be packed in bags which we were not expecting.  We pulled a couple 24hr shifts to get everything bagged and organized once received.  Since then, we have been packing our share of the orders.

Greetings all,
We are entering the final stage of this project.  Here is what's going on.
AU/EU:  Items are packed up and on their way to the distribution centers.  We have packed the orders on our side so all they will need to do is affix postage and ship it to you.  This was the best way to deal with avoiding customs since no matter what we do, there always seems to be an issue with some backers getting charged VAT.

Greetings all,
As we ramp up shipping, now is the time to make any last minute changes to your address.  After this Friday, it will be really close if you have a change.  Just send us a message or email with your updated address and we will take care of the rest.  
Here are some pictures of some items we didn't have during the project.  These were taken in the warehouse so it's not the best lighting situation.

    Four wanderers search for the Last Ruin, a city that legends say contains an artifact that will grant the greatest desires of the heart. A lost love, redemption, acceptance, a family rejoined-- these are the fires that fuel the wanderers' journeys, but can they overcome their own greed and inner demons on the way? 
In Near and Far, you and up to three friends explore many different maps in a search for the Last Ruin, recruiting adventurers, hunting for treasure, and competing to be the most storied traveler. You must collect food and equipment at town for long journeys to mysterious locales, making sure not to forget enough weapons to fight off bandits, living statues, and rusty robots! Sometimes in your travels you'll run into something unique and one of your friends will read what happens to you from a book of stories, giving you a choice of how to react, creating a new and memorable tale each time you play.
Near and Far is a sequel to Above and Below and includes a book of stories, an atlas of 11 maps with distinctive art and quests, and 4 playable characters with their own personalities and motivations. Each chapter of the storybook corresponds to its own map or character and is full of unique adventures. Answer the call of the ruins and begin your journey.
Recruit adventurers to join your party!
  Keep track of your character abilities and story over multiple games on character cards.
Build your character: Earn experience points and buy persistent abilities that last through multiple games.
Read connected stories: Experience a unique, connected character story where the choices you make determine your destiny!
Game Modes
First Adventure: Learn to play the game with this standalone map inspired by Above and Below.
Campaign: Play a series of 10 games on 10 different maps as you journey to the Last Ruin, building experience and buying abilities that last throughout campaign. Explore each map, experiencing stories unique to each location.
Story: Play a series of 3 to 4 games while following your character's main story, making decisions that will affect your ultimate fate.
Short Mode: Play 1 game of any map you choose, experiencing stories unique to that location.
Arcade Mode: (Stretch Goal) Skip the storybook and use a deck of cards, each with a brief encounter and set of choices.
How does this game compare to Above and Below?
Both games feature a story book that you read during the game, giving you a choice of how to react to a huge number of situations, people, and creatures. 
In Near and Far, all of the stories also have a reaction description, filling out the story AFTER you make each choice.  
Some of the stories are connected in thematic quest lines, so that choices made in an earlier story will affect the outcome and choices of later stories. 
The story book in Near and Far is at least twice as big as the book in Above and Below. There is a huge world to explore here! 
When playing campaign mode, all stories are linked to a location on the map. You'll see something intriguing on the map, travel to that location, and read a story to find out what is there.
If you play story mode, you pick one character and play through a focused, connected story line over 4+ games. Early choices you make affect later outcomes in the story! Each character features multiple story paths and endings.
    Retail Version: The standard retail version of Near and Far will have an MSRP of $59.99. It will include all stretch goals we reach here, but it will not include the metal coins. At conventions, the Deluxe Edition will be priced at $70.00.
Rulebook: Take a look at the prototype rulebook here.   
Changing Backer Levels: For this project we are unable to change or accept alterations to the backer level rewards. Backers may, however, double their rewards by doubling their pledge amount (for example, $100 for two copies of Near and Far Deluxe, and then add shipping only once). Backers may not triple or quadruple their rewards, etc. 
It is possible that Near and Far will be printed later by international publishers in various languages. Please take this into consideration when deciding if you would like to pledge. However, we currently do not have plans to license or translate this game.  
Backer Avatar  
Can I add Above and Below to my pledge? We are unable to offer Above and Below in this Kickstarter project. Please support your favorite game store and purchase a copy there!
    Rewards shipping to addresses within the US, EU, and Canada will be shipped from within the US, EU, and Canada.
International Shipping: As per Customs law, we cannot label the game as a gift for shipping. International shipments will be subject to customs charges depending on the country to which you are shipping.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my twelfth Kickstarter project, and with each project, I could not have printed and produced them without the support of Kickstarter backers. We've worked for months testing and polishing Near and Far. Much of the art is finished and the game is ready, but it won't see the light of day without the funds needed to see that the game is printed.

There are many other challenges to making sure this project is successful. Because of occasional unforeseen events, it is common for board game production to be delayed. I've done all I can to ensure that this game will be delivered on time if funded. Of course, delays can happen, but most of my projects have been delivered early.

Another challenge is making sure that all the files and rules are correct when sent to the printer. I've done the graphic design and artwork for many games. My experience helps me ensure a smooth pre-production process.

With your help, we can have the funds to print the game, overcome the various obstacles that are in the way, and make sure you are delivered a quality product.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Shipping
I hope you're having a good start to your week. This has been a huge project for us, with lots of twists and turns and a few complications, and we thank you for your patience during the fulfillment process. It's certainly been slower than I originally anticipated, and I apologize for the delay getting the games to you. All of the remaining shipments should be completed this week. We of course will make sure that you get what you pledge for. Please send an email to brenna@redravengames.com if you have any questions or if you are missing pieces.

Near and Far is now in the process of getting shipped!
What this means is that we have submitted our shipping documents to our various fulfillment partners in Europe, the US, and Canada. Our fulfillment centers are now entering the data into their own systems, assembling packages, and then getting packages in the mail.
A few people have received their tracking numbers already. If you receive a tracking number, that means your shipping into has been entered into the system, but it may take some time before it actually ships, so don't worry if it doesn't come right away. You also don't need to worry if you haven't received a tracking number yet. Not all addresses have been entered into the system yet.

Watch it Played
Rodney Smith of Watch it Played has uploaded a fantastic "How to Play" video for Near and Far! If you'd like to learn the rules for Near and Far before you get the game next month, this would be a great way to do it. And just a reminder that you can access the rule book for Near and Far on our website now.

May Shipping
Near and Far is a game that's absolutely stuffed full of components, as you can see in the unboxing video we shared in the last update. Because of this, the games took a little bit longer to assemble than we anticipated!
Because of this slight production delay, the games will be shipping in May rather than in April. Which is still on schedule for our initial estimated fulfillment date!

Unboxing Video
Earlier this week we received a couple of advanced copies of Near and Far. Unlike the pre-production copy, which was a little rough around the edges still, this is the final version of the game.
We filmed a brief unboxing video in order to show you all the gorgeous components! We're incredibly happy with how everything turned out.

Near and Far Progress
Hello, everyone! It's been over a month since our last update, so we just wanted to let you know that everything is still on schedule for April delivery.

Another Legacy part of the legacy! (we had to) Thanks to all our returning backers and new backers to the Legacy family! If you're still interested in any of these products you can stay in touch above at the "Late Backer" button.
In the meanwhile, stay in touch on twitter @lynnvander or through Facebook and of course on Boardgamegeek!
THANK YOU!
  Peter Pan is one of the most interesting stories in copyright law and history, being only open to specific public domain since 2007. So it's fresh and new to our world of open creativity. The creator of Peter Pan, J M Barrie also inspired us. When he passed away in 1929, he gave all the rights to Peter Pan to Great Ormond Street Hospital in the UK. GOSH (Great Ormond Street Hospital) grew and survived in part by the funds Peter Pan's play and book rights brought in for decades. As such, team Lynnvander is donating 5% of this Kickstarter (post fees) to GOSH!
  Having a legacy doesn't mean having to grow up! Travel to Neverland with Peter Pan and his allies in the third epic installment in the Legacy series! Neverland's Legacy is set in the same universe as Albion's Legacy and Sherwood's Legacy but is a totally stand-alone game that doesn't require the other Legacy games to play.
In this strategic, dice-rolling skirmish game, you help either Peter Pan and his allies or Captain Hook and his crew to assault their rivals on Hook's pirate ship or in the lost boys' camp respectively. At the start of the game, you'll choose which faction to play as and then set up the appropriate location to attack. Whether you're playing as Peter and his allies or Hook and his crew, you'll then assault your foes' base of operations, drawing cards to search every nook and cranny for lost boys, fairies, and pirate treasure, while positioning yourselves around the board to bypass or fight off your enemies. As your foes cause you to fall into despair, you are forced to roll Stones of Chance instead of choosing your actions, making it more difficult to take optimal turns.
As Peter and his allies, the game is won when you rescue all of the lost boys aboard Hook's ship. As Captain Hook and his crew, the game is won when you capture all of the lost boys hiding in their camp. In either case, the game is lost when your foes defeat enough of your characters! Neverland's Legacy is an immersive, highly thematic game that carries on the Legacy series's focus on super challenging co-op games.

 We're releasing some awesome ways to enhance your Legacy games with help from our allies at Norse Foundry and more! Introducing metal Stones of Chance and metal Destiny Tokens!
Add-ons!
You can add-on any item even without backing the game! Simply pledge at the $1 Kensington Kid level and add the appropriate amount to your pledge. We will survey exactly what you backed after the campaign through our post campaign Lynnvander store!

For more information on which add-ons are best for you, check out our infographic:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/i7b1vi3u6knnlqg/infographic.png?dl=0
If you already have metal mini's and want the Albion's new 7 character sculpts then add $35 to your pledge.
 What is the Legacy Series?
When Albion's Legacy was first created we wanted to do more than just one epic legend, so we decided to commit to a series of epic legends throughout time and culture that could culminate together to bring you the ultimate fantasy experience.
Neverland's Legacy is the 3rd Legacy game of 9. Below are a few titles you can expect to see in the coming 2016 and 2017 Lynnvander/Jasco release year. We'll take you from Feudal Japan all the way to the depths of Atlantis, whether riding a Chandelier as a Musketeer or sizing a French Castle as Joan of Arc, there will be something for everyone.
Future developed Legacy games
Each Kickstarter will focus on the newest family member to the Legacy series, however, we will always open up exclusive content for previous Legacy games. This content will only be available through Kickstarter. Below are our first two Legacy games. 
Albion's Legacy - Our first Legacy game! 
Albion's Legacy is a a fully cooperative modular-adventure game for 1-4 players (expandable to 6).  In Albion's Legacy, King Arthur and his allies explore Albion in search of specific Realms, while trying to collect enough Quest Coins to win the game! As the Realms are explored, various Enemies will stand in the way, and must be Challenged by rolling the Stones of Chance! Meanwhile, Despair threatens the land! If the Flames of Hope are extinguished, or all Virtue is lost, the kingdom falls! It's up to you to triumph against overwhelming odds!
Sample of retail game with all 7 expansions!
To learn more about Albion's Legacy and all of it's components - please visit our ALBION'S INFORMATION PAGE.

Sherwood's Legacy - Our Second Game!
A fully cooperative, tower defense style board game with a Robyn Hood theme. The successor to the Arthurian themed Albion's Legacy game.
Welcome to Sherwood forest. Take up arms with the best of the Merry men and women! Let's show the Sheriff he can't push us around anymore! Steal from the rich and give to the poor as Robyn and his allies defend Sherwood forest in this fully cooperative, tower-defense game.

    Lynnvander Studios is a Southern Ontario based game design company focusing on the creation of board games from concept to deliverable files. Our work for major publishers in the industry includes the design of Buffy the Vampire Slayer: the Board Game, and Galaxy Quest: the Board Game.
We use Kickstarter because we love the community that's formed around our past campaigns and because, with your help, we can make games that we never would have been able to manufacture on our own, and we can make games that are bigger and better than would have been possible without your support. With that in mind, we've got an aggressive Kickstarter lineup planned for the coming year so get ready for a whole lot of new games!
The Legacy line is exclusively published and distributed through our amazing partners at Jasco Games.
  Many companies use Kickstarter as a sort of preorder system for moving finished products - that’s not us. We’re a small team of 6 game designers, most of which are part time. We’d like for most of our team to be full time but we’re still building up to that and making our place in the industry. We’ve been very lucky to build relationships with other companies that have allowed us to work on big licensed properties but our original properties are still a passion for us. That’s why we’re forging ahead with our line of Legacy games. With your support, we were able to manufacture Albion’s Legacy, send it out to tons of backers, and bring it to retail. You’ve also allowed us to create Sherwood’s Legacy and Deep 5 which are in manufacturing now.
As you may know, we were appalled by the production issues and poor quality of the 1st edition of Albion’s Legacy and, with your support, we were able to reprint Albion’s Legacy through a new manufacturer, and send an improved copy of the game to all of our original backers for free. Despite tons of amazing backers helping to cover the costs of the 2nd edition of Albion’s Legacy through our micro-kickstarter, this created a huge financial expense for us that we’re still recovering from as a company. That’s a very real reason why Kickstarter is still crucial for us to create new games. Plus, we love bringing the Legacy series to Kickstarter, and interacting with all of you along the way. With your help, we're going to make Neverland's Legacy way more awesome than we could have on our own.
Shipping will be charged after the campaign, based on the actual cost to ship your pledge reward to your location. We will not charge any handling fees above the actual cost to ship your game.
Through our strategic partnerships, we have arranged fulfillment options in multiple countries, significantly reducing your shipping costs. We will be shipping from locations in the United States, Canada, and the UK, saving you the cost of customs and VAT fees.
Please Note* Shipping to Military bases can be costly. Message us for details.
Since Albion's Legacy has already been funded and fulfilled once, your copy will ship within 2-4 weeks of this campaign ending. You'll have the option to hold your game and wait for Neverland's OR ship it immediately. Sherwood's Legacy is still in manufacturing stages and is set to ship by the end of the summer. You may also elect to ship Sherwood's sooner or not.
All mini's and bonus content will released at the same time as Neverland's Legacy with exception to GripMats which in the case of Albion's and Sherwood's, may ship immediately.
Please Note* We open to any shipping options you can work out with us. We want to get these products in your hands as quickly and least expensive as possible. Contact us with any inquiry and we'll respond asap.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've come a long way and have learned a lot about Kickstarter and game manufacturing in general but challenges still come up.

Our first game, Albion's Legacy, was a good game but very poorly manufactured. In response to the poor quality of our first product, we've reprinted the game and given the reprint to our original backers for free. While this commitment to quality is important to us, it's caused significant delays and pushed fulfillment of our other games back. With a better understanding of the industry, and the help of a great manufacturer, Deep 5, and Sherwood's Legacy are well on their way to being fulfilled. With nothing left for us to do but wait for manufacturing to be concluded, and ship out the remaining games, it's time for our team to get back to what we're best at: making new games.

We're confident that this campaign will be a smooth process but delays can happen. Sometimes the art takes longer to complete than we'd expected. Others, shipping or customs hit us with surprise delays. Whatever happens, we'll communicate with you honestly and openly and do everything that we can to provide you with a high quality game.

Risks of workload, shipping, customs, art delays etc. But promises on making this game a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We've sent a LOT and we're stoked to see what happens next.  about 8 packages have returned to us - we'll be contacting those backers (pending on which campaign you're a part of) so they can arrange address checking. We've made sure to update all of you who've emailed us the changes.  We're excited to say that the process is going quite smooth.  Here's a pic of one of the waves that went out...

Hey all, 
The packing has been an absolute mountain to complete. But we're over 60% packed and the first waves are lifting off!  People should be receiving product in the next couple weeks and continuing to do so for the next 3-4 weeks as product spreads around the world! 
Don't panic if something doesn't show up.... we'll work it out, case by case and resolve it as quickly as we can okay? 
It's been one hell of a logistics job and we were not suited for it.  But our volunteers and Lynnvandarians have been suuuuper helpful and we're on their time.

campaign.story:
Moroz Publishing and Rightgames teams hearty thank all who backed the Mechanical Dice Towers! Thank you very much!!!
The late pledging via PayPal will be open until the end of summer 2016. You can contact us by sending a message to Moroz Publishing — just click on the company name located on top of the main campaign page: it’s next to the snowflake, which is a company logo. You may also send us an e-mail to moroz@morozpublishing.com
In a few months after the campaign all these awesome towers will become available at the Rightgames online store. Please note that shipping will cost more as we cover 1/2 shipping expenses during the campaign, and there will be no Kickstarter exclusive First Player tokens and additional free dice bags (of course!).
LET THE DICE ROLL!
————————————————————————————————————
Load dice, then push down on the stylish lever. BANG! Random results guaranteed, along with a privilege to use dice towers that you won’t find anywhere else!
We are proud to present the Orc Totem and the White Castle — dice towers with a rotating platform. Unlike ordinary towers, you don’t throw your dice inside. Rather, you place them on a special platform, and let them loose with a special lever.
In addition, we’ve created MDT-7 — a compact collapsible dice tower. This one easily fits in your bag and takes just a few seconds to fold out!
Dice towers come with awesome First Player tokens, created specifically for this Kickstarter campaign! Each of the three tokens accompanies its own dice tower.
The approximate value of each of these First Player tokens is $6. They won’t be available for separate sale.
Here is the deal: only now on Kickstarter, you get your First Player token for free with the appropriate tower!
And even more! We give away a red velvet dice bag with each dice tower your purchase. Just for free!
  The Orc Totem is the original dice tower. Everything started with it. We exhibited it at Essen last year, and were surprised with unbelievable feedback we got. A dozen test copies that we brought to Essen vanished before the end of the first day. It was incredible!  
Many people stopped near our booth just to see how the tower works. It’s really fun to watch! You place dice on top, press on the mushroom, and as the totem orc rolls his eyes fearfully, the dice tumble down. Not for the faint hearted!
The turning platform of the Orc Totem works for small and medium dice. You can also throw dice through the mouth of the daemon on the back. This way you can roll even the biggest and the baddest of your dice! A wooden fence keeps the dice from rolling too far.
  The White Castle is absolutely amazing. First of all, it's huge! When you set it on the table, no matter what board game you play — everything becomes just... epic!
The Castle comes to life when you press the tiny turret on the top. Click! The dice start their thundering journey through the depths of the tower. The Castle’s portcullis is lifted, and a medieval king, a queen, a knight and a minstrel appear in the gothic windows.
All our dice towers are covered with gorgeous laser engravings. However the White Castle stands in a league of its own. It is decorated with masonry, winches, hoists, and more. Furthermore, it’s laminated with white plastic. Enough words — just take a look at this beauty!
  Now for our little baby. MDT-7 is a collapsible tower that can be folded and unfolded in a few simple moves! Two or three seconds — and your dice have a place to roll!
MDT-7 doesn’t have a special dice throwing mechanism, as per the Orc Totem and the White Castle. Rather, MDT-7 is designed for portability. It is perfect for board-game parties when you need a dice tower, but don’t want to be lugging around too much stuff.
One more thing. Does the folded MDT-7 remind you of anything? A Warhammer 40k tank, you say? Well, if that’s how it is… Enemy sighted — ready the dice! Give ‘em a round of d6! Load the armor-piercing d20!
Our towers are all built of HDF — high-density fiberboard. It’s famed for its strength and durability. If you’re not planning to smash your tower with a hammer, sit on it, incinerate it (which isn’t even all that easy to do!) or any other such nasty things — the tower will serve you for many years!
Tactilely, HDF is quite pleasant. The surface is smooth and flat. All towers are made with a laser, so the edges are free from burrs.
All parts fit each other perfectly. Assembling these towers is a piece of cake. As for gluing, it is not necessary at all. However if you wish to glue all the parts together, most common glues like PVA will be okay.
Rich laser engravings are applied to each of the towers. The towers look amazing as they are! Still, you are free to paint them if you want. Though preferably the Orc Totem and MDT-7, the White Castle has been painstakingly laminated.
More about painting in our update.
The Orc Totem, White Castle and MDT-7 are shipped in HDF punchboards. This is how it looks:
You will need to carefully press out the tower pieces. This procedure is simple and takes only a few minutes.
Each tower supplied with detailed instructions:
Note. If you order only the Orc Totem, it will arrive to you without the punchboard. We press out all the pieces for you in advance. This is done in order to reduce the shipping cost. Not all that important, but we prefer to make the things clear!
In addition to dice towers, we offer high-quality bags for your dice!
There are 2 different sets available: the Black and White set for $18 and the Multicolor set for $24. Each set includes 3 bags with either black-and-white or color pictures. Every picture in each set is dedicated to its own tower!
The bags are made from 100% linen. It’s probably the best possible material to store dice and tokens. Such bags are smooth to the touch, well-ventilated, and durable. And they are washable, of course. Pictures won’t wash out!
Crafting. The picture is printed on the fabric with a special printer. Then it’s finished with a thermal press. Only then the bag is sewed on the mechanical frame. This is not a high-volume manufacturing. This is true piece work!  
How to: To purchase bags, press ‘MANAGE’ on the top of the page, then select ‘Change your pledge’, add the cost of chosen bag sets in the ‘PLEDGE AMOUNT’ field and confirm the new amount.
You can read about these nice linen dice bags in more detail in this update!
We put all our love and expertise into our dice towers. Hence, we have no stretch goals like "when we collect X money — we add something to the tower". All that we wanted to do has already been done.
However, if funding from this campaign exceeds our expectations (which are, by the way, a secret =), we promise to give you something exclusive and very special. We still have a couple of cool ideas, and perhaps you’ll be able to help bring them to life!
The first such idea has come to life already. We are happy to add a free red velvet dice bag to every tower you purchase!
Now every tower comes with a dice bag and an amazing First Player token. These are not stretch goals, but just free presents from us! Our hearty gift to everyone backing us on Kickstarter!
    The main things you want to know about shipping:
Knowledge comes with a click! You will see the shipping cost by simply choosing a reward to the right of this page.
One for all! The shipping costs are the same, no matter the destination. The only difference is in the type and number of towers you order.
More is less! The more towers you order, the cheaper is shipping per tower!
Tax Free! We do not claim «EU Friendly» and so on, but we are very close to it. In our case, there are no customs taxes for 99% of the known world. More details in FAQ section, at the bottom of this page.
At the ready! We will start making and sending towers about a month after the end of the campaign. We hope to ship the last tower in September. Many of you will receive your towers earlier than the estimated delivery date!
Your choice. You are free to choose any combination of towers and calculate shipping by yourself. Read about it next!
We’ve prepared multiple rewards for all the main options: any one of three towers, any two towers, three towers.
However, you are free to choose whatever you like — for example, two Orc Totems and one MDT-7. This way you’ll have to calculate the total sum yourself, following instructions below. (Or you can cry for help, and we’ll be happy to do it for you!).
For custom selection of towers please choose the very first reward level, called “Free choice”.
Next, calculate shipping costs:
1. The Orc Totem and MDT-7 are counted as 1 unit. White Castle is counted as 2 units.
2. Shipping of the first unit costs $8. Add $4 for each additional unit.
Example #1. You decided to buy a White Castle (2 units) and two MDT-7 (1 unit each). Total: 4 units. Shipping of the first unit is $8. Shipping of the remaining three units is $4 per each. Final shipping: $8 + $4x3 = $20.
Example #2. You decided to buy three Orc Totems (1 unit each) and two MDT-7 (1 unit each). Total: 5 units. Shipping of the first unit is $8. Shipping of the remaining four units is $4 per each. Final shipping: $8 + $4x4 = $24.
Add the costs of your chosen towers (MDT-7 = $14, Orc Totem = $20, White Castle = $35). Add the shipping cost as described above. Pledge your resulting amount, choosing the “Free choice” reward. Done!
You can also add up to 10 linen dice bag sets. Adding them does not affect the shipping cost.
Important! If you want to get 6 or more towers units, please contact us directly. Maybe we can give you an extra shipping discount!
We are based in Russia. Although our trips to Essen Fair give us an opportunity to exhibit dice towers to visitors, it’s not enough.
We know how great these towers are! We are delighted with what we’ve created, and our wish is to share them with the world. Kickstarter is the best chance we have to achieve this!
Fedor and Sergey are both involved in Rightgames company. It is one of the oldest in Russia in the board games industry. Fedor takes care of the company’s general service activities, and Sergey is the executive producer and head of production.
The dice towers idea was originally born as a fan project. Long evenings spent with the laser cutter, drawings, guesstimates, experiments... In the end, it turned out into something really awesome!
We’d like to add that towers project is carried out together with Moroz Publishing. Denis Davydov from Moroz is the one who answers all your comments and messages here!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sergey Machin, the main responsible for the production in Rightgames, fears that lasers will attack him at night and burn orcish totemic symbols onto his back. That he won't be able to read, because its very inconvenient to read from your own back. That is what scares him.

Fedor Myachin, the creator of Orc Totem tower, worries that people will buy so many towers that he and his team will be cutting wood and packing shipments day and night. But Ivan Tulovskiy, the President of Rightgames, would be rather pleased with that outcome. He loves it when people are working!

Seriously though, we have a lot of experience with laser cutter production. Our towers are crash tested. They were assembled, checked, disassembled, jumped on, hammered, punched, slapped, again assembled and still everything works as it should! We take pride in quality.

Rightgames has been producing and shipping board games and accessories for over 10 years. Of course, unforeseen circumstances can always arise. Nevertheless, we strive to deal with everything on our side and make sure you won’t even notice if something unexpected happened.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've taken the initiative with packing all coin sets to minimize production time, making it as simple as possible for the supplier which means a faster turnaround.

Last year we experienced a huge issue that resulted from the supplier producing the wrong amount of coins. By us sorting and packing everything in the USA, any shortages will be able to be identified while the coins are still in the factory. If this occurs this time, production of the "short list" can begin while the bulk of the coins start their journey on the ocean. Once complete, they will be shipped via Air and arrive approximately at the same time. We don't expect this to happen this year; however, if it does, we will be ready.

VAT: We will be billed directly for customs and duty. Standard rates apply; however, discounts will be taken into account during calculation.

International Shipping: We have worked out great deals for this years shipping; however, it can take a little longer to arrive (a few days) but is certainly cheaper than USPS. Dare we say we are EU Friendly?!

Packaging: Bags inside of clamshells or bags inside of boxes which are inside of a box...we aren't taking any chances with how the postal system plays with the mail. Couriers are going to love us! :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"How to lose your friends and rule the world"? Revenge of the Dictators fulfills the dire need that's inside all of us. Our pick-up-and-playcompetitive boardgame features Dictators in a ratrace for World Domination. Just disarm some Nuclear Facilities, annoy your fellow Dictators like it's the last thing you'll do, confront the President of the U.S.A. and BOOM, rule the world...
So why should you fund this game?
You just LOVE:
Being a dictator
Cut-throating and backstabbing
Losing your friends
Playing games with your non-die-hard gamer friends
Our artwork as much as we do
Although you might recognize some look-a-likes from real Dictators, we want to make sure you know we're not using any of them! Instead, we're using some lesser known grand leaders like Adolf 'the Hipster', Saddam 'the Sadist', and Kim 'the Young-One'.
Kickstarter Limited Exclusive* bonus
Every backer will receive this Kickstarter Limited Exclusive bonus card featuring a well-known favorite American all-time hero. Pure awesomeness!
*This content will only be available in the first print run.
Still not satisfied? Check out our American Agent "Bob" Expansion
With this first expansion, you're able to play with a 6th "friend", except this friend will do anything to prevent the Dictators from succeeding. Bob has his own powerful abilities ánd a special deck of cards, which might force the Dictators to...play cooperatively? That's a dirty word!
The American Agent deck consists of several powerful cards only usable by the American Agent. The special agent acquires these cards by discarding Command cards, or visiting some special sites like Area 51 and the CIA HQ. 
The American Agent can also go undercover, to do so he or she rolls a six-sided die at the start of his or her turn. There is a 50% chance that this will happen after which the American Agent stays "undercover" (removing his or her pawn from the board) until a dictator is spotted. Spotting a dictator gives the American Agent certain tactical advantages, for example increasing the DEFCON level. After all, the Amercian Agent wins the game at the end of DEFCON 1.
Here are some incentives we are offering to all our backers:
€10 off MSRP: pay only €35 instead of €45. 
Get your name in the Rulebook.
The opportunity to help us design extra Command cards.
What about a Dictator card with your likeness? 
Get a Kickstarter Exclusive bonus card!
Add the first Expansion pack with a total new gameplay AND at a discounted price of €12 instead of €18. That's 33% OFF!
Note: the "Funding Father", "World Domination" and "Don't Push The Big Red Button!" pledge levels will also include the majestic beard, traditional Hawaiian Lei, sleeves and sticker sheet.
Additional Dictators, including our higher pledge level backers, will be added soon.
The game is played in turns, with the best dressed up Dictator starting the game. At the start of the game every player receives a unique Passport-card of a Dictator, including a special ability!
A turn consists of up to 3 of the following actions, in any combination:
DRAW a card 
PLAY a card 
Use your TRAVEL ACTION (Max. 1)
To disarm a Nuclear Facility you first have to make sure you're in the right place. Second, you need to spend your Travel Action and an additional action to attempt the disarming. Finally: roll a 3-6 with a 6-sided die. If your opponents let you, you're now one step further to World Domination. Perhaps you'll even get an awesome wacky bonus?
If you reach Washington D.C. you have a chance of confronting the President. At the start of your turn, draw a Presidential card to see if the President is indeed present. Next, roll a 20-sided die and throw a minimal number, depending on how many Nuclear Facilities you disarmed.
Presidential Card
And really, that's it. At least, if you were playing by yourself. But you shouldn't do that according to mommy. There are 122 unique cards, which makes every game different! Apart from your opponents, the U.S.A. uses some anti-Dictator systems as well: DEFCON and Founding Fathers.
For an advanced gameplay run-through download the [concept] rulebook, which will be available in English, German and Dutch (depending on the backers possibly even more).
                                                                                                We think retailer backers should be able to receive the same Kickstarter extras as other backers. In addition, they should receive their rewards before we release regular games into distribution. If you're an interested retailer, please contact Alina at alina@blackboxadventures.com during the campaign for pricing information.
In order to be fair to all backers, we will charge shipping after the Kickstarter based on the actual costs. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends through BACKERKIT. In addition, we are using Backerkit because it allows us to save time and focus on fulfillment so we can make sure you'll get your game in time to conquer the world!
We're talking to a few fulfillment partners in order to get the lowest shipping costs possible. We're even driving to some countries to ship directly from there. In addition, we offer you the opportunity to pick up your game at some conventions: Essen SPIEL 2016 (more to follow). The shipping charges below are the maximum charges.
Comrade & Party Member pledge levels:
Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg: €8 (approx. $8.95)
Rest of Europe: €12 (approx. $13.40)
Rest of the World: €20 (approx. $22.35)
Per extra base game (excluding the expansion, we'll include this one for free!) the shipping costs will increase as follows:
Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg: + €2 per game (approx. $2.23)
Rest of Europe: + €7,50 per game (approx. $8.37) 
Rest of the World: + €15 per game (approx. $16.75)
Black Box Adventures consists of three passionate tabletop gamers from the Netherlands. We are looking for enthusiastic people that would like to help us fund our first game. The early works on this project started almost 5 years ago and we really are looking forward to sharing Revenge of the Dictators with you. As with all Kickstarter campaigns, without your help and support, Revenge of the Dictators might die a horrible premature death, and thus drain all hope of it giving you tons of fun.
Why Kickstarter, and why 20.000?
Well, first of all there is the minimum manufacturing number of 1.000 pieces. We're working with a very trustworthy high-quality game manufacturer located in our vicinity. We even visited the manufacturer to see for ourselves, as we like to triple-check things. This gives the additional advantage of not needing to send the total package from a foreign producer, thus saving us and you freight shipping costs and time.
Second, the stunning artwork and graphic design. Art isn't cheap, especially if you put as much work and effort as Frederick van de Bunt. We chose to integrate both the artwork and the graphic design through one person, in order to have a consistent style and to smoothen out the working process (a chain is only as strong as it's weakest link, and now we only have one link..a really strong one... you know what we mean!).
Lastly of course there is the small cut Kickstarter and our Pledge Manager takes. We're not counting the prototype costs, review packages, final prototype, review fees, final prototype 2.0, marketing and all the time and love we put into making Revenge of the Dictators to what it is now. We are not here to make money: we are here to share our beloved project with the world! Every stretch goal reflects this purpose and is designed to add more content and quality to the base game. Therefore, your support really makes a difference!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although this is the first game that Black Box Adventures has launched on Kickstarter, we want to put any concerns to rest. While every project has risks, we've done our best to minimize any complications. 

All the designs for the game are close to final with any changes coming from additional backer input and stretch goals. In addition, Revenge of the Dictators has been thoroughly play-tested (over 300 playtesters).

We received a lot of quotes of multiple manufacturers, both domestically as well as foreign. In our opinion our choice of a local manufacturer offers the best price/quality rate. We have established solid ties to this manufacturer, as we have inspected the facility ourselves. Once the campaign concludes, we can start to get the manufacturing started asap. We were promised by the manufacturer that the game will be ready before Essen SPIEL 2016, however some events may be out of our reach. If for some unforeseen circumstances we won't be able to deliver the product at Essen SPIEL 2016, we have to arrange a pickup at another convention or charge shipping costs.

Shipping is always a risk, especially when shipping international orders. Because the game is produced in the EU, EU-backers won't need to worry about extra customs charges. We're doing our best to reduce shipping costs for backers worldwide. Backerkit will provide us a lot of help in managing all the pledges, so we are able to focus on the fulfillment.

Lastly, this Kickstarter also marks the start and future of Black Box Adventures. This means that we will do everything in our power to listen to the backers, so together we can make the best we can out of Revenge of the Dictators.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Evolution: Climate is a stand-alone game for 2 - 6 players in the best selling Evolution product line. The Evolution base game is so vivid and true-to-life that it was recently featured in the world's leading scientific journal, Nature.
In Evolution: Climate, players adapt their species in a dynamic ecosystem where food is scarce, predators lurk, and the climate can swing between scorching hot and icy cold. Traits like a Hard Shell and Horns can protect your species from Carnivores while a Long Neck will help them get food that others cannot reach. Heavy Fur and Migratory can protect your species from the cold while being Nocturnal or Burrowing will provide protection from the cruel desert sun. With over 200,000 ways to evolve your species, every game evolves into a different adventure.
If you don't own Evolution, then buy the stand-alone Evolution: CLIMATE ($55 pledge level). It contains everything you need to play Evolution: CLIMATE.  
If you already own Evolution, then buy the Evolution: CLIMATE conversion kit ($25 pledge level).  It contains everything you need to transform the base game into Evolution: CLIMATE.
Below are links to 3rd-party reviews of Climate prototypes. Some details may be different in the final game. 
GeekDad: "I can’t say enough how impressed I’ve been with the Evolution game series, and I highly recommend taking a look at Climate." Full Review
SpaceBiff: "Not only are you competing with other species, but against the land itself. There are new methods for survival, a fresh crop of ways to die, and even more reasons to play it over and over, observing as different combinations of interdependent species, fearsome carnivores, and the climate itself conspire to prevent you from thriving. This is Evolution at its toughest and most rewarding." Full Review
FatherGeek: "The Climate track introduces a lot more strategy and tactics. I have to think more about what I will add to the Watering Hole, what Trait cards to use, and what situations I need to prepare for." Full Review
Climate features original watercolors by world-renowned nature artist Catherine Hamilton. Catherine taught as a professor at Rhode Island School of Design between 1997 and 2003. She was featured in the 2012 HBO documentary "Birders: the Central Park Effect" and has developed a body of work that crosses the boundaries between artistic and scientific investigation.
Nocturnal Critters!
Epic Volcanoes!
Giant Beasts!
Defensive Horns!
Scorching Deserts!
Terrifying Carnivores!
FAT TISSUE!!!
Raging Wildfires!
We'll post more art from the game as the campaign progresses. Catherine Hamilton is hard at work at this very moment creating wonderfully beautiful watercolors to help bring this game to life. What's this? It's the middle of the night you say? It doesn't matter! Catherine Hamilton does not sleep.
Evolution: CLIMATE stand-alone comes with everything you need to play the game. It comes with 48 new CLIMATE trait cards and a modified version of the 129 trait cards from the Evolution base set.  
Technical Note for those who care: It is possible (although a little cluncky) to play the Evolution base game using the components from the Climate stand-alone.  Read Update #4 for details.
The Evolution: CLIMATE conversion kit comes with everything you need to convert your base set of Evolution into Evolution: CLIMATE.  
1) Remove Ambush, Burrowing, Defensive Herding, and Carnivore from the trait cards in your base set of Evolution.  
2) Shuffle the 86 cards from the conversion kit into the remaining base set cards.
3) Use the Climate Track instead of the Watering Hole. 
 This video shows how to play the base game of Evolution: 
Evolution: CLIMATE builds upon the rules of the Evolution base set. The centerpiece of Evolution: CLIMATE is the Climate Track, a 21" x 9" Watering Hole that keeps track of the climate and features a dramatic watercolor vista by Catherine Hamilton. Here's a prototype of the Climate Track made from her rough draft concept sketch:
CLIMATE TRACK PROTOTYPE - Not final art!
The climate moves between scorching hot where large animals die from the heat and icy cold where small animals die from the cold. This system is intended to mirror the actual effects of ambient temperature on animals.  Here is a link to the "surface area-volume ratio effect" science that is being modeled. Food is abundant when the climate is warm and scarce when it is scorching hot or freezing.
Every new trait introduced in CLIMATE helps prevent population loss from the heat or the cold. Species will need these new traits to adapt to extreme climate conditions. In the base set Evolution, species had to adapt to food scarcity and predators. Now there is an additional threat to survival: Mother Nature!   
Adapting to a Changing Ecosystem!
The heart of the Evolution game system is adapting to a continually changing ecosystem. There is no best strategy or best card combination in Evolution: Climate.  
Video Overview
The  only video overview we have of Climate was done by a German. This will help you understand the new additions that Climate brings to the base Evolution game.
  Stretch goals marked Kickstarter Exclusive below will be available in limited quantities at northstargames.com after the campaign is over and rewards have shipped. 
Among them, you'll see Oversized Scenario Cards. These are 70x120mm cards, illustrated by the fabulous artist Anna Kryczkowska, each of which changes a fundamental aspect of the game.
To use them, players pick a scenario card before the game begins and the rule described on it will apply through the entire game. Example: the Cretaceous Period card specifies each species can have an unlimited number of traits.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
North Star Games has been publishing board games for over 12 years. We know what it takes to produce high quality board games in large quantities. We have top notch employees and customer service.

This is our third Kickstarter campaign associated with the Evolution product line, and by now we have a clear idea of the pain points for a campaign of this type.

For example, one mistake we made in the last campaign was to use several distributors to ship to different regions around the world. This made fulfillment complicated and made it hard for us to monitor shipments. As a result too many boxes arrived to backers damaged, or failed to arrive at all. 

Now, instead, we're using a single fulfillment house which specializes in shipping rewards worldwide, one recommended by Jamie Stegmaier, whose campaigns are the gold standard in this area. This allows us to get games to you more reliably and more cheaply, and that backers automatically get tracking numbers. 

As ever, unforeseen manufacturing problems can arise. The chances are low because the components for the expansion will be made by the same manufacturer that makes the base game, the Evolution: Flight expansion, and with whom we have a productive relationship. If a manufacturing problem should arise, we have lots of experience working through manufacturing issues, and can bring it to bear.

Finally, whatever problems may arise, we will continue our policy of replacing any components with which our backers aren't satisfied. This minimizes the risk to you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Villages of Valeria is a village-building card game in which players establish resources, construct buildings, and attract adventurers to become the next capital city of Valeria. Take on the role of a Duke in the vast and beautiful kingdom of Valeria and, on your turn, lead the table by selecting an Action - Harvest, Develop, Build, Recruit, or Tax - for everyone to perform while you get a slight advantage for being the Active Player.
Villages of Valeria is a stand alone game set in the world of Valeria and takes place just before the hordes of monsters invade the kingdom in Valeria: Card Kingdoms. 
Updated Once Per Day - ~6000 Deluxe Copies Pledged and climbing!
In Villages of Valeria, 1 to 5 players compete to build the best village in the kingdom in about 45-60 minutes.
Card Anatomy
There are two main cards in Villages of Valeria: Building cards and Adventurer cards. 
Surprising strategic decisions with just 2 types of cards!
Building Cards can be used in two different ways: 
You can pay the Resources listed on the left to build the Building and use its power during the game. 
You can Develop it as a Resource by flipping it upside down and placing it under your Castle. 
Adventurer cards are attracted to your village by certain Building types listed on the left of the card. Pay Gold to add them to your village to use their power or reap Victory Points at the end of the game. 
Game Flow
The game is played over several rounds where players take turns being the Active Player. The Active Player chooses an Action and, in turn order, all other players may follow and do the same Action but at a slight disadvantage.  
Actions
HARVEST: Draw 3 Cards. 
   Follow: Draw 1 Card. 
DEVELOP: Discard 1 card to add a Card to your Castle as a Resource.
   Follow: You may discard 2 cards to add a Card to your Castle as a Resource. 
BUILD: Place Gold on Resources to add a building to your village and draw 1 card.
   Follow: You may place Gold on Resources to add a building to your village. 
RECRUIT: Pay 1 Gold to add an Adventurer to your village.    Follow: Pay 2 Gold to add an Adventurer to your village. 
TAX: Collect 1 Gold and draw 1 Card.
   Follow: None.
Victory!
The game ends after the turn in which any player's Village contains the target number of Buildings and/or Adventurers. This can happen either because the Active Player has built a Building or recruited an Adventurer, or because another player following the action has done so. The entire Action is played out, so even if the Active Player has triggered the end of the game, all other players still get a chance to follow the Action and add to their own Villages.
Count up your Victory Points and see who's village will become the next capital city of Valeria!

campaign.story:
My name is John Wrot!, the designer of The King's Armory, and I would like to share with you my newest game creation: A.D.A.P.T. 
A.D.A.P.T. is a passion project that stemmed from a leveling up game mechanisms and a love of dice.  In A.D.A.P.T. I've created for you somewhat of a mash-up style fighting game that combines those two loves.
A.D.A.P.T. is a mid-to-light weight card and dice game that...
has mighty new Leveling, Drafting, and Mash-up game mechanisms.
implements ocean-deep strategies via tons of abilities and body part combinations that are as fun to build as they are exciting to use.
is designed to use full sets of polyhedral dice that directly support the above leveling mechanisms and strategies (21 unique Halfsies Dice included).
About A.D.A.P.T. (updated)
A.D.A.P.T. is a mashup style battle game with a unique new experience-based drafting mechanism where each player starts as a humble guppy fish and then upgrades his body over time, while forcibly Adapting new parts, to create a Frankenstein-level "Masterfish", all in preparation for battle to be come the last Masterfish in the sea. 
Alternately stated: It's a unique, clever, fast-playing game about mutant fish battling to the death. : )
In A.D.A.P.T. all players share one deck, and every single card in the deck is unique; unique art and unique stats! That means that whatever you buy I can't, and whatever I buy you can't.  As a result you'll not only Adapt your fish, but you'll also have to Adapt your strategy.
A.D.A.P.T. plays in 30 minutes, and is designed for 2-3 players ages 13+, but can adapt to meet the needs of larger gaming groups (up to 6), as well as younger players (ages 7+).  Between A.D.A.P.T.'s in-game rules for playing with kids ages 7+, and the fact that all fish in the core game are real animals with stats and abilities based on those real animals, A.D.A.P.T. can serve as a reliable learning game for play with the younger crowd, while remaining, at it's core, meaty enough for the adults it is designed for.
To learn more about how the game plays, see our "How it plays" section below.  And thanks for backing A.D.A.P.T.

We all know that conspiracies are real. They are trying to clone Hitler, role-playing is actually devil worship, and the Reptilian overlords are watching our every move! The problem is that for some reason people ignore these obvious facts. That has to change, and quickly--before it's too late! 
Conspiracy! is a card game for two to four conspiracy theorists with the guts to seek the REAL TRUTH in the face of opposition from "THEM".  
During Conspiracy! players reveal and strengthen conspiracies, each of which grant the player some special power. Additionally, players work to discredit the insane conspiracies of other players (what nut jobs!) by leaking stories to the tabloid press. Points are scored for the conspiracies left at the end of the round and those that are accepted as possibly true by the public double in value. The game ends when a player crosses one hundred points. The highest score wins.

If you would dare to read the rulebook for Conspiracy! it is available for download HERE. We promise such downloads are not tracked by the Reptilian overlords. We also have a very little frills print and play version you can download for free (No DNA sample required!) although cutting and assembly is required. You can find that HERE.
Disclaimer!!! - Absolutely no mind control of any kind was used in obtaining the following reviews.

                                        * Interested retailers please contact us.
Conspiracy! is available world-wide and will ship from within the US. US shipping is included. Shipping fees for outside the US will be $10 because we are subtracting the amount for US shipping from your shipping cost.
