See "Shipping" for more details
Reviews
"I enjoyed my time with Greatest of All Mountains. It has some very interesting ideas and was most certainly a unique game in and of itself. The idea of bringing up a mountain at birth and setting it up on high was rewarding."- Father Geek. Parent and Child Geek Approved. Full review here.
"I've seen these mechanics in other games but mixed with this theme, I thought it was really well done, really well put together. I appreciated how the complexity or the in-depth-ness of the phases increased as you went... You can put in a lot of strategy if you want to, but you can also sit back and enjoy building yourself up as the mountain." -NVS Gameplays
Greatest of All Mountains is a competitive Mountain building card game for 2-5 players that can be played in 45-90 minutes. The game currently includes nearly 160 cards.
Each player represents a mountain which is vying for the title of Greatest of All Mountains. To achieve this, players must acquire the most victory points in the three phases of the game, using various abilities and events to gain an advantage over the other players.
Examples of Terrain: Ancient Forest & Ancient Glacier
In hopes of achieving the high honor of being named Greatest of All Mountains, each player must first form the terrain of their mountain. By adding slopes, lakes, cliffs and more to their mountain they craft the foundation of their strategy. Players may also compete to gain the all or nothing "Tallest Mountain" award for additional VP.
The Phase 1 deck
Next, players must build facilities on their terrain. This is where strategy becomes very important as the facilities built greatly effect how the next phase will play out. Build the best facilities on the faces of your mountain or choose to build sub-par facilities on your opponent's mountains.
Finally, each player must attract tourists to their mountain. The goal is to get tourists to your mountain's "Safe Zone" where they will be scored at the end of the game. Tourists frequently change hands, so players must employ a variety of strategies and abilities to make sure their tourists are safe from the other players. With your support we can make Greatest of All Mountains a reality.
Skiing isn't just for humans.
For an overview of gameplay visit: https://youtu.be/-kmqrLUSHlE
To view the complete rules: https://www.dropbox.com/s/m93vrtso8awd5jb/Rules.docx?dl=0
BGG page: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/180224/greatest-all-mountains
Phase 1: Formation, Phase 2: Settlement and Phase 3: Tourism
 Why Greatest of All Mountains is Great
It's a Casual Game with Strategy- One of the best aspects of Greatest of All Mountains is that it's a fairly casual game but players can strategize as well. Luck does play a role, especially in the first phase, but even then players can make decisions and take risks by taking or passing up a card on the table. In the next two phases, decisions players make could win or lose the game for them.
Gameplay That Suits Several Play Styles- While this game is competitive and there are more than a few ways to mess with your fellow players, Greatest of All Mountains does not force you to do so. It is a legitimate and sometimes winning strategy to focus on improving yourself. There's a life lesson in there somewhere.
It's a Good Warm-up Game- Greatest of All Mountains is a great way to start off a game night. It's not terribly complicated but you need to make decisions too, making it a good primer for deeper strategy games later on.
I currently have about 50% of the artwork completed. I need to have the artwork for Phase 2 & 3 completed. Once the artwork is finished the game will move into production. Once I have the final copies, I'll send them out to you.
Here is a breakdown of where the funds will be going:
Madness Expansion ($17,000)- New terrifying Terrain, Facilities, Tourists and Events for your Mountains to incorporate.
New Terrain “Slippery Slope”, “Unnatural Crag” and “Insidious Hollow.”
New Facilities “Spaceship Wreckage”, “Haunted Hotel” and “Underwater Temple”
New Tourists “Paranormal Investigator” and “Cosmic Horror”
As well as sanity-withering new events. (2 additional events per Phase.)
Inner Peace Expansion ($21,000)- Embrace the tranquility of nature with these new cards.
New Terrain “Wild Flower Meadow”, “Babbling Brook”, and “Hallowed Ground.”
New Facilities “Picnic Area”, “Paved Trail”, and “Relaxing Resort.”
New Tourists “Mountain Biker” and “Office Drone”
Peaceful(ish) events (2 additional events per Phase.)
Additional stretch goals will be unlocked as the previous ones are reached, including improved packaging and additional expansions.
Hot Springs and Gentle Lake
 Shipping
For this project I will be using the shipping and fulfillment service Ship Naked. They offer customs-friendly shipping to the European Union, Australia, and Canada, so you don't have to pay additional customs charges. Shipping in the US is included at every backer level, except the $1 and $10 levels. Actual shipping costs will be added when you back.

Thank you all for a fantastic campaign! For the latest, see www.terratilesystem.com.
Coasts and Rivers is a tabletop terrain system that will let you spend your time gaming instead of making terrain. It is the newest set in the TerraTiles terrain system, and it features beautiful river banks, elegant coastal tiles, and dirt paths. Quick to set up, and easy to take down, TerraTiles is ready right out of the box to turn your whole table into an awesome battlefield regardless of what game you play. There’s nothing to assemble, paint, or flock, and the terrain itself doesn’t get in the way of your miniatures during the game. In short, TerraTiles is fantastic terrain without the hassle! Click here for a FREE Print-n-Play pdf to try them out!
The Misty Moorlands Kickstarter campaign in January of 2015 was met with great success, and even before the campaign ended, the backers had lots of great ideas for terrain features they wanted to see included. This Coasts and Rivers set was born from those ideas, and when Coasts and Rivers is paired with The Misty Moorlands, the possibilities are endless!
We have been playing tabletop games our entire lives and wanted to provide the gaming community an alternative to green tablecloths. So, we set out to create an easy to use and inexpensive solution that could also create incredibly diverse battlefields. We believe TerraTiles is the best, most comprehensive table-top terrain solution for the following reasons:
Created by You - We polled over 450 backers from the Misty Moorlands Kickstarter campaign to determine which terrain features the community wanted. Then we tailored the Coasts and Rivers set specifically to them!
Quick Set-Up - Each hexagon measures nine inches from corner to corner, so you can cover a table quickly and easily. Each box covers 24 square feet.
Variety - There are nearly an infinite number of ways to assemble a TerraTiles board
Compatible with Any Game, Genre, or Scale - Use TerraTiles for all of your miniature gaming. Check out this GeekList for all of the games our backers are using TerraTiles to play!
Easy to Store and Transport - TerraTiles takes up no more room on your shelf than a regular board game.
Compatible with Your Standalone Terrain Pieces - Place your buildings, trees, and other terrain pieces right on top of TerraTiles!
With all of these features TerraTiles will be your go-to terrain system!
Every TerraTiles: Coasts and Rivers box will contain 60 double sided hexagon tiles, which is enough to cover over 24 square feet. As part of the $25,000 stretch goal, each box will also feature 6 double sided half hexagon tiles to straight the edges of the board. 3D standup trees and walls will be included in every Coasts and Rivers box - 9 trees and 6 walls. It also includes reusable putty to secure your TerraTiles to the table. While the number of hexagons in the box is fixed, their distribution will change if stretch goals are reached. To ensure Coasts and Rivers matches The Misty Moorlands, the hexagons will showcase a matte finish and linen texture. Here's Heath to show you our advanced prototype so you know exactly what you will be getting:
The graphic below shows everything currently in the TerraTiles: Coasts and Rivers box. We’ll keep it updated as any stretch goals are reached.
Misty Moorlands is the first TerraTiles terrain set. It was funded on Kickstarter in January of 2015. It features 60 double sided tiles and 6 double sided half tiles with a variety of terrain features ranging from open grassland and forests, to streams and rocky terrain. The size of the tiles matches Coasts and Rivers exactly, so you can combine the two sets to create some amazing boards! The graphic below shows everything included in the Misty Moorlands box:
Take TerraTiles to another level! We are offering a set of precision-cut expanded polystyrene risers to provide battlefield elevation. The risers are one inch thick and strong enough to support even your heaviest miniatures. Use them to raise any of the existing hexagons to different levels, greatly increasing the amount of variation in your battlefields and adding important strategic depth. The risers are white and can be painted any color you choose. Each package contains ten risers. If you would like a package of risers shipped to you as part of your Kickstarter rewards, be sure to select one of the reward levels in which they are included, or add 24 USD to your pledge for each additional package of risers you would like to add on.
We have set the Kickstarter funding goal for TerraTiles as low as possible to get it into production. But, this means we need your help to make the TerraTiles: Coasts and Rivers box as robust as it can possibly be. Therefore, we put together a stretch goal ladder based on campaign funding and an achievement ladder based on social media shares. All Coasts and Rivers boxes will include all stretch goals reached. 
The social media achievements are reached by sharing this page on Facebook and retweeting the official campaign launch tweet. Facebook shares, retweets, entries in the TerraTiles GeekList, and "thumbs" given to the GeekList will be added together to reach the achievements on the ladder above. With the help of the Kickstarter community, we can make an already outstanding terrain system even better!
We are @RAINN_Studios on Twitter if you would like to follow us. We're live-blogging the campaign there, so if you want up-to-the-minute news about the campaign, that is the place to be. :-)
*While supplies last. All miniatures are supplied unpainted.
All add ons will be shipped with your pledge rewards. No additional shipping fee is necessary with any add on so long as you have pledged at the $64 pledge level or higher. War of Kings was our first Kickstarter project and board game; for more information see www.WarOfKingsGame.com.
Money Back Guarantee - We understand the risk you are taking to support our project, but we are very confident you will love playing your games on TerraTiles. To demonstrate this, we want to extend a money back guarantee to all of our backers. If you are unhappy with TerraTiles, return it within 30 days of delivery for a full refund, no questions asked.
Kickstarter Exclusive Hexagon - The graveyard hexagon will not be included in the retail game box. Backing our Kickstarter project is the only way to receive this special hexagon.
Kickstarter Discount - By pledging on Kickstarter, you will receive TerraTiles at a discount from its MSRP of $74.95.
We Need You - We have paid for the art and created the prototype, but only your support will enable us to manufacture and distribute TerraTiles. Your support will also help us to increase the quality of TerraTiles as we reach the stretch goals.
Influence the Coasts and Rivers Design – In anticipation of all the great ideas we know the community will have during this campaign, we have included stretch goals that will enable you to vote directly on new art to commission for the set!
TerraTiles creates a beautiful table with lots of terrain options while still being very practical for game play. Each tile works with all of the others in any orientation. The streams, roads, and coasts each enter and exit in the middle of a side of the hexagon, so they link seamlessly with the adjacent hex. The stream hexagons do not have a distinguishable current, so they may be used in either direction. The sandy shore hexagons can be used to depict a shoreline or can be put together to create a wide river. The putty included in the boxed set can be placed in a few spots around the board to prevent sliding.
TerraTiles depicts a variety of easily distinguishable terrain types that can be used with any number of rule sets. You will find lightly wooded and heavily wooded hexagons, as well as difficult and very difficult ground.
We understand you would rather spend your hard earned money on games rather than shipping, so we have done as much as possible to keep shipping costs to a minimum. Therefore, we have worked to make this Kickstarter campaign EU Friendly by coordinating with Ideaspatcher. We are also partnering with Snakes and Lattes in Canada and an Australian fulfillment center to help bring down the cost of shipping to those areas. Rewards shipped to backers in the US, EU, CAN, and AU will have their rewards shipped from within those countries.
The shipping costs below are applicable to all pledge levels and do not increase, no matter how much you pledge.
We welcome any retailers who would like to support TerraTiles: Coasts and Rivers and get the Kickstarter version to sell in their stores. Our retail policy can be found here. Whether you operate a brick-and-mortar or web-based store, please message us directly through Kickstarter or email us at info@rainnstudios.com for information on pledging.
Ian Schofield has returned to work with us to produce TerraTiles: Coasts and Rivers! He used the moorlands of Scotland as inspiration and really produced some fantastic pieces. Here are a few of the layouts you can make with TerraTiles. These utilize Misty Moorlands and include stretch goals.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our third Kickstarter campaign, and we have learned a tremendous amount from the previous two campaigns. We are applying every lesson that we learned to this campaign.
 Therefore, when this campaign is successful, we expect TerraTiles to move smoothly from Kickstarter to production. And, because we are partnering with three international fulfillment services (in the EU, Australia, and Canada), our fulfillment process has become more efficient. However, there is always the potential for unexpected surprises. Art can take longer than expected to finalize. Subcontractors can take longer than expected to produce the components. When the product is inspected for quality control, a flaw could be found and a part may have to be remade. As we found with the Misty Moorlands Kickstarter, even unexpectedly heavy rain at the manufacturer can slow down packaging for shipment as shipping containers have to be dehumidified to ensure the contents don't mold on their trip across the ocean! Any of these would slow down the production of TerraTiles. And of course, even once TerraTiles leaves the manufacturer, there is still the potential for delays with freight shipping, customs clearance, distribution, etc.
 However, if you back the TerraTiles: Coasts and Rivers Kickstarter campaign, we will keep you well informed and up to date about its progress from the campaign’s close all the way to when the rewards are shipped. As you can see from our previous campaigns, we post regular updates, so you will know what we know when we know it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Zombicide: Black Plague is a standalone cooperative boardgame for 1 to 6 players that brings the relentless zombie-killing action of Zombicide into a brand new fantasy setting! Players control a party of survivors as they fight to rid the land of an invasion of zombies controlled by the game itself. Survivors find weapons, learn spells, battle zombies, and gain experience. The more experienced they get, the more powerful they become, but the more zombies rise to face them!
Here's a look at everything we've unlocked!
Zombicide: Black Plague is much more than just the classic Zombicide game you know and love, transported into a fantasy world. While it retains the general Zombicide mechanics, several changes and additions were made for this new iteration.
Black Plague's brave survivors: Clovis, Nelly, Baldric, Ann, Samson, and Silas
Black Plague brings a whole new breed of survivors to Zombicide, hailing from all walks of medieval life, and even including some fantasy races like dwarves and elves! Each of these heroes posses their own unique abilities to face the zombie horde, from familiar skills to all-new ones.
A survivor's plastic dashboard, with a full inventory of cards
Each survivor in Black Plague receives a quality plastic dashboard to keep them organized. A built-in sliding arrow tracks experience gains, and plastic pegs mark wounds and indicate new skills. Finally, multiple slots hold all your cards, making the new inventory system intuitive and structured.
Each card's symbol indicates the slot where it's used. Weapons and magic spells must be equipped in-hand. Armor must be worn on the body. Special items like extra arrows can be stashed in your backpack. Survivors have varying equipment specializations, allowing them to equip a particular card on the body slot, and still have it instantly accessible.
Armor introduces a new twist for Zombicide veterans. A survivor wearing armor (or carrying a shield) has a chance of blocking multiple zombie attacks with a lucky roll (although it’s no help against the Abomination).
The Black Plague itself: Runner, Walker, Necromancer, Abomination, and Fatty
The zombie hordes shuffling around Zombicide: Black Plague’s alleys were raised by powerful Necromancers. When these dark masters enter the board, even more zombies spawn every round. But, instead of mindlessly chasing survivors, Necromancers will try to escape and spread more dread across the land! If they’re not eliminated, the avalanche of zombies only gets worse!
The always terrifying Abomination ignores your armor, and is practically invulnerable to your weapons. Your only hope is to lay a trap of Dragon Bile in his path. Light it up with a torch at the right moment, and you’ll see there’s almost no problem that can’t be solved with the judicious application of Dragon Fire!
The highly detailed Black Plague survivor miniatures
And the frighteningly detailed Black Plague zombies!
Zombicide: Black Plague comes with dozens and dozens of incredibly detailed miniatures. Survivors have detachable colored plastic bases to help identify them, matching the color of the pegs on your survivor dashboard.
A sample of the 9 tiles included in Black Plague
The Black Plague tiles create a rich and intricate medieval town. Street zones don't spread across multiple tiles, creating lots of twisting alleys for you to try and evade the oncoming undead. And if you find one of the secret vaults, you may be able to cross the entire map a lot faster (and you may even find a couple of very powerful artifacts down there).
Zombicide: Black Plague comes with:
9 double-sided game tiles 
71 miniatures 
6 survivor plastic dashboards, color bases, and ID Cards 
48 plastic trackers 
6 dice 
125 cards
63 tokens
1 Rulebook
Preview Rulebook:
http://cmon.co/ZF-BP-RULEBOOK-KS
Please be aware that this is a Preview Rulebook. It is not final. Rules may still be tweaked and changed, layout and graphics may still be altered. So, if you see anything in here that isn't the same later, understand that during the Kickstarter the project is still in development and all aspects are subject to improvements.
But that's not all we've uncovered from this ancient time!
Zombicide: Wulfsburg is a blood-curdling expansion for Zombicide: Black Plague!
Wulfsburg's dauntless survivors: Theo, Ariane, Karl, and Morrigan
Wulfsburg not only introduces four new survivors to your Zombicide: Black Plague games, but each of them comes with their own plastic dashboard, colored bases and trackers. That means this expansion allows you expand your group to up to 10 survivors at the same time!
Wolfz and the terrifying Wolf-Bomination!
You'll need all the help you can get when fighting the Wulfsburg zombies: packs of ravenous zombie wolves (or Wolfz)! Even faster than Runners, these Wolfz can easily tear apart any careless survivor. And pray the pack leader doesn't show up. Just as relentless as the normal Wolfz, the hulking Wolf-Bomination is as resilient as any Abomination, also ignoring any armor on its attacks.
The powerful magic weapons from Wulfsburg
To help you on your quest, Wulfsburg comes with several unique magic equipment. Most of these items are so powerful that survivors are only able to wield them once they reach a specific danger level.
The new tiles in Wulfsburg introduce a new strategic feature into Zombicide in the form of large towers you can climb. From the ramparts, you can fire at the zombies below, but they have to go all the way around to the stairs to reach you. This high vantage point even allows you to fire over buildings, provided your attack has enough range.
The highly detailed Wulfsburg miniatures
 Zombicide: Wulfsburg comes with:
2 double-sided game tiles 
22 zombie wolf miniatures 
4 survivor miniatures and ID cards 
4 plastic dashboards and color bases 
32 plastic trackers
30 cards
1 Rulebook
Join us for a little session of Zombicide: Black Plague with the CMON team and special guest Steve Avery!
Huntsman - $100
Huntsman Level pledges will receive: Zombicide: Black Plague (MSRP $100) + Hero Box (MSRP $25) + All Applicable Stretch Goals.
Knight - $150
Knight Level pledges will receive: Zombicide: Black Plague (MSRP $100) + Zombicide: Wulfsburg (MSRP $60) + Hero Box (MSRP $25) + Gowan exclusive survivor miniature and ID card + All Applicable Stretch Goals.
The Hero Box that all Huntsman and Knight level backers will get contains not only 5 new Survivors to add to your zombie-killing party (including their miniatures and ID cards), but also 2 more plastic dashboards, each with 8 colored plastic trackers and color base, allowing you to add two more players to your game!

This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.

Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in Germany (EU backers), China (Asia Pacific backers), Canada (Canadian backers), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers) or Atlanta (USA and the rest of the world). campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 18th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as: 
Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is December 2015, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 90% complete, we don't believe this is in the least bit likely. We've successfully delivered Zombicide, Sedition Wars, Guilds of Cadwallon, Zombicide Season 2, Relic Knights, Rivet Wars, Kaosball, Dogs of War, Arcadia Quest, Wrath of Kings, and XenoShyft. Zombicide Season 3 has been fully sent out and being delivered to the last backers, and we are in the process of delivering our Base System and The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service.

We have three ongoing projects currently: Rum & Bones which is in the final stages of production, Blood Rage which is well advanced, and B-Sieged which is starting production.

Please refer to our individual project pages if you'd like to check the progress there. Each project is entirely independent of each other and have completely different development teams and have no effect on the production flow or development of Zombicide: Black Plague.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 60 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 60 days close of the campaign are processed via Paypal only. Refunds within 60 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, we will treat it as abandoned and will refund or ship on a case by case basis.

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active. You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

campaign.story:
Battalia AVATAR package (in 4 colors)
Hello Everybody, And Welcome To The World Of Battalia!
First, let us introduce ourselves in one sentence. We are a small team of passionate board game players, (including a warrior, a snow queen, a leprechaun, a dwarf, a giant and a dream walker), who also have some experience in board game publishing and who with a little help form their friends, after more than 2 years of development, have finally finished their first own game. Hurray!! If you want to learn more about us, check our bio, website and the information at the bottom. Now, let me walk you trough our project.
In general all game material is LANGUAGE INDEPENDENT
(you need the translation of the game rules only!)... and here we go :
The game comes with English rule book inside the box and printed Bulgarian rules for all the Bulgarian backers. There are high quality printable PDF files available for the following additional languages: German, French, Italian, Spanish, Brazilian portuguese, Chinese, Croatian, Czech, Polish, Hungarian, Russian and Ukrainian.
*Please scroll down to Rulebooks section to download all presently available files. We will add continuously new layouted PDFs of all translated languages, as soon as they are ready :). 
Let me introduce you our DREAM TEAM which is responsible for this quick and high quality translations of the rules and reference sheets. Please note, that those guys are half-gods, because they accomplished the uneasy job in less than 10 days, so please think about before messing up with them :) We are pretty sure, that they have super special powers :) and we love them for this reason. We are and will be grateful to them for eternity! 
Thank you so much guys! HERE IS OUR WALL OF FAME :
for Spain (and Chile): Don Javier de la Maza
for Italy: Grande Doge - Fabulous Fabio Piovesan 
for China (Hong Kong): Kung-fu Master Angus Lee
for Croatia: Gospodin Rudolf Amazing Renaud
for Bulgaria: Хан (Khan) Alex Guerov
for English: Khaleesi Ledha Guerova with the assistance of Lady Jennifer Swainsbury and Sir Sebastian Swainsbury
for Germany: Kriegsherr Jan-Malte Frieg with huge additional help from the Burgherren Frank M. Kuhn and Thomas Heck
for Poland: Pan Radoslaw Zemsta
for Brazil (Portuguese): Мestre Mario Bianco Pedroso
for France: Monseigneur Luc Decamp with enormous support from Monsieur Jerome Pasquier 
for Czech Republic: Mistr Tomáš Hubka & Pan Daniel Hausknecht
for Hungary:  Erik Fischer
for Russia/Ukraine: Богатырь (Bogatir) Oleksandr Ruppelt
What kind of game is this?
BATTALIA: The Creation is a medium weight strategy game for 2-4 players, ages 13 and up. An expansion for up to 6 players is on our schedule, but for now let’s focus on the basics (for more information about the expansion see our section "future plans"): the game combines the mechanics of map construction, deck building, hero and area control and unique calendar mechanics.
What actually happens during the game?
In the base game, you will buy useful artefacts and hire battle units to support your armies, you will build roads and cities and send your heroes to battle - you will have to find the most powerful mixture of all these assets and apply them at the right moment, so you could claim to be the rightful ruler of Battalia and win the game. A victory can be obtained through aggressive conquest or a peaceful development of your own city system (if you are lucky and the others let you :) . The interesting game play will provide you with the opportunity to make key decisions and turn the tides of even the grimmest outcomes. A player can outmaneuver and BE outmaneuvered by his opponents at any point during the game. Dynamic atmosphere and intense battles are key factors in the overall experience, however the game strives to stimulate planning and strategy over rash and impulsive decisions. In general this is not a luck based game, because of the core deck building mechanics, but a die is integrated as an optional element and is the ingredient, which spices up the game for all the fortunate fellows! You will find also an element of bluffing, when you fight your battles, so put the poker face on and be ready to outsmart your opponent. The game is defined by the unique combination of mechanics, aesthetic art style, and the presence of large scale 3D Hero figures in four colors, representing the leaders of the players army and their movement on the board.
Game Features:  
Language independent
Basic game mode 
Advanced game mode for experienced players 
Alternative game scenarios - including completely new game setup for adventurous type of players. 
Modular map, built during the game 
Four factions - the Bearfolk, the Cloudborn, the Emberians, the Islanders 
Unique calendar mechanics 
Unique cards purchase mechanics 
Video rules (available at the end of this summer)
What is in the box?
Game board
A special dial, called “The Sun Oracle”
330 cards
61 City tokens.
8 Miniatures
4 Reference sheets
1 Die - standard D6
And of course - a Rulebook - 12 pages
Units are the heart of any players deck. There are four types resp. ranks - Frimen, Chiefs, Priests and Lords. These cards are used for creating new artefacts, building roads or cities and of course for conducting battles.
There are seven types of artefacts, each of them with its own special ability. The players use them for faster development, to upgrade their units, to transform their factions, to travel on the game board, etc. - they will give you a lot of flexibility.
The Great Artefacts are powerful objects crafted in ancient times. Every one of them has its own unique ability and provides big advantages to the player who earned it.
Terrain cards can be cities or roads. They are used for the construction of the map, and.. well - to gain victory points. No matter how strong is your deck, if you don’t have cities, you have nothing!
What we have here is 56 x 56 cm game board, city tokens to mark the level and the owner of the cities, reference sheets to help the players with the different costs in the game and the supply cards which are actually very, very important cards, as they are used for hiring units, building roads, traveling and more. Now, let me tell you a few words about the Sun Oracle, shortly called Orac, as it is a key element of the game. The Oracle is almighty ancient monument, eternal apprentice of the nature itself and the hand of the gods among humans and beasts. The Oracle provides advantages to the players and it could support you, if you catch the lucky moment on a sunny day... It counts the days and guides you through the never-ending competition between the folks that inhabit these lands.
The Reference sheets: a great additional aid for beginners - 12 x 18 cm. They are double sided and describe all the artefact abilities, all the creation costs, a player's turn sequence and some important rules!
Some pictures of the first prototypes and size reference.
The miniatures. There are 8 large scale miniatures which represent the players’ heroes in the game. These figures are the leaders of a player’s armies and mark players’ presence on the game board. Plus - they look amazing!
The factions.
Four factions coexist in the world of Battalia. Most of the cards in the game (units, artefacts and terrain cards) and the 8 figures belong to one of the four factions. A leading concept in the game is that the four factions can freely collaborate with each other, but many units from the same faction, using their own artefacts, are much stronger together. Also, unlike all other games where the players choose their factions, in this game the factions choose the players.
English - Ver.1.1
                                                                                                                                          French - Ver.1.1
German - Ver.1.1
Spanish - Ver. 1.0
Italian - Ver.1.0
Brazilian portuguese - Ver.1.0
Chinese - Ver. 1.1
Polish - Ver. 1.1
  Czech - Ver. 1.1
Croatian - Ver. 1.0
Russian - Ver.1.0
Ukrainian - Ver. 1.0
   Hungarian - Ver.1.0
We have serious plans for the future and actually already working on the first big expansion of Battalia Universe. We want to expand the universe step by step and you will get even more nice artwork, beautiful miniatures and interesting game play! The first expansion will include game material for 2 new factions, resp. for 5-6 players, additional peace of game board, some new Great Artefacts with new powers, the Storm Gates - places on the map, which you can use to travel from one to another gate in a different parts of the much bigger map for 6 players.... and of course a few new miniatures - 2 Heroes for the Wolfsclan and 2 Riders for the Tigerblessed :). We will add some NPCs (Mouflon & Mammoth riders), which belong to nobody, but will be aggressive to all heroes and will be moved from all players (clockwise) according to a special rule in one single turn...  The NPCs will come through the Storm Gates and because they are extremely strong, they will try to make troubles on the map. Since we'll have 6 Gates - the D6 will decide from which gate they will appear each particular time :) ! All of this will come with the first expansion and we do not want to add more to the game play now, because of so many reasons. Balance is always important! And sometimes to add MORE is actually LESS in terms of the quality of the game play. The game is already a deep strategy game, so we fear that the complexity of the game will rise to unknown heights, if we add a lot of specific abilities now. That's why, we are very cautious with this topic and will add only the portion which is tested and already approved from our designers team (s. f.e. the Hero Sheets down below). The rest will come with the expansions. Please watch the reviews, all of them emphasize one thing - that the game is actually easy to learn and accessible, but very complex and deep as it is in the basic version.
                                                                                                Click on the picture to see all designs.
                                                                          REVIEW: BATTALIA THE CREATION on BGG, by Nikolay Zhekov
Short Introduction from OTSBGR, that gives a very good quick overview:
Review from Michael Von Kirchmeyer - Off The Shelf Board Game Reviews
And now we have an actual SAMPLE GAME-PLAY VIDEO from Michael - Off The Shelf Board Game Reviews
Here one more video showing Game rules - the LONG version. In part 1 Michael explains all the rules in detail!
Battalia: TC Review from Undead Viking
Battalia: TC preview from Board Game Brawl with Nick Meenachan
* Designer team note: The game material shown in the OTSBGR and Board Game Brawl videos are very early PROTOTYPE - The reviewers got the game a few weeks ago and meanwhile, we've improved a lot the design of the cards and other components like the Oracle and Game Board.
We ship from EUROPE (with lowered US shipping rate)
We lowered the shipping costs as much as possible for this campaign. The main shipping prices are described in the pledge categories and they will not change, if you pledge the category as described!  
But we have to explain some special cases. For example if you want to put some ad-ons in a specific pledge category. This action has the impact, that you will add unknown weight to something, that is calculated as it is and in the most cases even 200 gr. (f.e. for one T-shirt or a dice box) could change dramatically the shipping cost situation, since the most of our rewards are calculated to be under 2 kg. - it counts as a "small package" and has relatively low shipping costs worldwide. Even in this case we cover a big part of the shipping costs to many overseas and other countries just to be able to offer you the best possible basic shipping conditions for the "basic" reward levels. But with all stretch goals unlocked, we will be really on the edge of this limit of 2 kg. and we will face completely new situation.

So our solution for this problem: if we reach the $80 000 stretch goal please add $5 for every add-on you pledged in addition to the standard levels, because the weight of the delivery package will overstep the 2 kg. limitation and the shipping costs will be more than doubled. Please note: in this case Fantasmagoria will cover even bigger share of the increased shipping price, so the $5 will be your more or less "symbolical" contribution to the changed situation. In this case we will ask all backers with add-ons to increase their pledge on a voluntary base supporting us to solve the difficult shipping problem.

Before reaching the $80 000 stretch goal  everything stays as it is .... no pledge changes have to be made! In general all of this concerns only ADD-ON backers, but if you want to help us out with the difficult situation feel free to add $5 as standard pledge backer. We highly appreciate this!

One more thing: please note that we've tried to calculate a great game with a lot of components and cool miniatures plus many additional stuff as stretch goals to a very low basic price! We hope that you will understand, that the pricing for shipment is out of our scope and we can do a lot of compromises, but somewhere we have to make the final cut.

Thanks for your understanding!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
On one hand we are just a small company and this is our first Kickstarter project, but on the other we have been publishing board games for the past five years now. We are cooperating with more than 30 famous publishers like FFG, KOSMOS, Hans im Glueck, AMIGO, IELLO and others. During this time we have published Bulgarian localized editions of many worldwide popular board games such as “Game Of Thrones: The Board Game”, “Sid Meier’s Civilization”, “The Legends Of Andor”, “Ubongo”, “Carcassonne”, “Wizard”, “Atlantis”, “ King Of Tokyo”, etc… This means a lot of EXPERIENCE for us! Our production sites are located mainly in Germany, US and China, so international logistics are not an obstacle for us and meanwhile we know very well how to play the “big game” called PUBLISHING. 
Please note: the estimated delivery date is mid-November 2015, but please keep in mind that this is only an informed guess. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We will do our best to minimize this as much as possible, but if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all we are always ready to refund pledges in full. 
Of course, there are risks with every project, but we hope that our track record in publishing and our commitment to do everything as good as possible will gain your trust in us , dear Backer! Battalia: The Creation will be our first own “baby” and we don’t want to do anything wrong after two and a half years of development. 
Production shipping or customs delays are always possible, but since our game is 95% complete, a small delay is probably the worst thing that could occur on this project. The most sophisticated part of our project is probably the production of the Battalia heroes. Yes, exactly – these large and beautiful, but really complicated for production figurines. They are expensive, the process takes a lot of time and commitment, but the result is really worth the effort . To ensure a smooth and accurate production and delivery, we are cooperating with an old partner who is among , the best production factories in Germany - a renown specialist in the board game field with really high quality standards for everything they produce – miniatures, game material, game board, boxes and so on…. This should put everyone's minds at ease, regarding quality and delivery schedule! 
We have no reason to expect that something could go terribly wrong, but in case that this happens, please check our refund policy.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, charges included, NO QUESTIONS ASKED. After this period a refund without any explanation is still possible, though that’s minus Kickstarter and Stripe payment processing fees (as we will not be refunded by them after this 60 day period). However, once we’ve begun packaging your rewards for shipment (usually 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), refunds are no longer possible. 
Important: If a game or component cannot be delivered at all (which is very unlikely), at your wish we will refund you the full amount, including fees, or we will try to work with you per e-mail and find a satisfactory solution for your individual case. 
Please note: All refunds requested during the original 60 day period are returned to your credit card via Stripe. Refunds requested after this period will be processed via PayPal only!

10' to kill is a deduction game, for 2 to 5 players, played in 10 minutes or so. There are 16 characters on the board, and each player secretly embodies one of them.. Each player also has 3 secret targets he must eliminate, without being discovered. The players have two actions each turn, (choosing from the following) : move any character anywhere on the board, eliminate a character (different ways of doing it), make an identity check by the police. The trick is, when a character is eliminated, nobody says by who or how ! You must apply yourself in blending your true hitman in a crowd of possible suspects, or guess which character is the hitman of the other players.
As time goes by in 10' to kill, you will feel pressure and suspicion weight on your shoulders. 10 minutes is a short time, but it can sometimes be very long when all eyes are on you! You'll have to bluff and use discretion to eliminate your targets ... and maybe the competitors hitmans!
Are you ready to become the most prestigious hitman?
10' to kill is our second game after Invazions (released in 2014). A year and half was needed to develop this well-balanced game and to create a unique, immersive and very tense gameplay. We are proud to introduce this game which is very important for us. We need you to fund it. We hope you will enjoy playing it as much as we do.

Simple rules for a maximum of bluff and fun !
At his/her turn, a player has 2 actions among 3: 
Move a character on the board, including policemen. 
Kill a character. 
Investigate a character’s identity using a policeman. 
A player can do the same action twice, but for killing. Only one kill per player and per turn is allowed.
Move a character :
A player can move any character he/she wants on the board, including policemen. To move a character, take it and put it on any other location tile.
Kill a character :
Once per turn, a player may kill a character on the board. A character can only be killed with the player’s hitman. The hitman must use one of the 3 authorized weapons to kill: Gun, Sniper Rifle or Knife. The hitman must remain unseen when he kills his target. (For more details read the rules book). When a player performs a kill, he takes the victim and says: “this character has been killed”. The player never says nor reveals the character he/she used to do it or the way he/she used. Because keeping their hitman secret identities is an essential part of the game, players should try to kill with as many suspects as possible. But remember, a hitman can only kill someone if he/she is not seen by other characters or policemen!
Investigate a character’s identity :
A player can choose to investigate the identity of a character on the board. Identity checks are performed only by policemen. Move a policeman on a tile with a character on it and investigate his identity. If the character is the player’s hitman, he must reveal it. The player who discovered the hitman's identity takes the character and the matching tile and put them in front of him.
A player is never eliminated from the game. Even when he /she has lost his/her hitman, the player can still play and win by discovering the identites of other players.
When the party is over, players count their prestige points according to what they have in front of them !
In the game there are 2 kinds of location tiles: normal and sniper rifle potential spot.
To use Sniper rifle, your hitman needs to be on a blue edge location tile marked with a "sight" symbole.
When starting a game, build the board as you want. We recommend that you do not make square. Let your imagination fly!
Asymmetric boards are more fun !

La boite de jeu was born in late 2013. Benoit, Benjamin and Timothée have been knowing each other from high school, but have since worked in different fields. Gathered by their common love for boardgames, each one of them brings his own skills to the company. This teamwork allows them to publish games with a really good care: from a great idea to a great product.
Founder of La boite de jeu, Benoit is the core member of the company. He's also a game author (Invazions, 10' to kill) and uses his knowledge to interact with the authors, to choose the artists and to select the games-to-be. He's also a fairly average Magic player but he carries on hoping that one day he will go to pro-tour!
Benjamin studied Advertising in a French school and takes care of the communication aspect. From website creation to rulesheet page layout, he uses his skills to bring a proper communication for every game. He told us that once he opened the fridge using the Force, but we still have our doubts...
Man in the shadow, Timothée is the manager of the company. He takes care of the accounting, the logistics and so on, to make our player fantasies possible. He told us he's also the nephew of the cousin's brother of a guy who once knew the real Harry Potter!
Pauline is the artist of 10' to kill. Professional graphic artist she is all into illustration work, photo and video. She graduated from Emile Cohl school of art and she completed her training within ICOM Lyon (France). After serving for two years as art director in an advertising agency from Lyon (France), she now works on freelance for agencies, companies and individuals on various media creations. Pauline would like to be professional NBA player. But we haven't told her yet that she's not allowed to play with her feet.
A big thank you to Mathieu and Thibal who helped us a lot with this game! They are a bit ugly (so no photos to preserve your eyes) and wicked but they were very helpful.
The game will be produce in Poland by Axel.pl. We know this partner, we know the quality of his work and we are very confident for 10' to kill. This printer is already working with many boardgame publishers (Galakta, Pegasus spiel, etc...) and quality is always at its best.
After the campaign, we’ll need about 3-4 weeks of work to finalize everything and about 3-5 weeks for production (provided by the printer). Then the games will be sent to backers. That is why Septembre is a reasonable delivery time.
Thank you for your support!

Deyan Georgiev, BigBoxGamers.com
Hello Everybody, And Welcome To The World Of Battalia!
First, let me introduce ourselves with one sentence. We are a small team of passionate board game players, (including a warrior, a snow queen, a leprechaun, a dwarf, a giant and a dream walker), who also have some experience in board game publishing and who with a little help form their friends, after more than 2 years of development, have finally finished their first own game. Hurray!! If you want to learn more about us, check our bio, website and the information at the bottom.
Now, let me walk you trough our project.
What kind of game is this?
BATTALIA: The Creation is a medium weight strategy game for 2-4 players, ages 13 and up. An expansion for up to 6 players is on our schedule, but for now let’s focus on the basics: the game combines the mechanics of map construction, deck building, hero and area control and unique calendar mechanics.
In-Game Layout
What actually happens during the game?
In the base game, you will buy useful artefacts and hire battle units to support your armies, you will build roads and cities and send your heroes to battle - you will have to find the most powerful mixture of all these assets and apply them at the right moment, so you could claim to be the rightful ruler of Battalia and win the game. A victory can be obtained through aggressive conquest or a peaceful development of your own city system (if you are lucky and the others let you ... :) .
The interesting game play will provide you with the opportunity to make key decisions and turn the tides of even the grimmest outcomes. A player can outmaneuver and BE outmaneuvered by his opponents at any point during the game. Dynamic atmosphere and intense battles are key factors in the overall experience, however the game strives to stimulate planning and strategy over rash and impulsive decisions.
In general this is not a luck based game, because of the core deck building mechanics, but a die is integrated as an optional element and is the ingredient, which spices up the game for all the fortunate fellows! You will find also an element of bluffing, when you fight your battles, so put the poker face on and be ready to outsmart your opponent.
The game is defined by the unique combination of mechanics, aesthetic art style, and the presence of large scale 3D Hero figures in four colors, representing the leaders of the players army and their movement on the board.


Game Features:
Basic game mode
Advanced game mode for experienced players
Alternative game scenarios - including completely new game setup for adventurous type of players.
Modular map, built during the game 
Four factions - the Bearfolk, the Cloudborn, the Emberians, the Islanders
Unique calendar mechanics
Unique cards purchase mechanics
Video rules (available at the end of this summer)

What is in the box?
The game contains the following components:
Game board
A special dial, called “The Sun Oracle”
At least 333 cards
A bunch of city tokens - 61 pcs.
8 Miniatures
4 Reference sheets
1 Die - standard D6
And of course - a Rulebook - 12 pages
And here is the components breakdown:
Units are the heart of any players deck. There are four types resp. ranks - Frimen, Chiefs, Priests and Lords. These cards are used for creating new artefacts, building roads or cities and of course for conducting battles.
There are seven types of artefacts, each of them with its own special ability. The players use them for faster development, to upgrade their units, to transform their factions, to travel on the game board, etc. - they will give you a lot of flexibility.
The Great Artefacts are powerful objects crafted in ancient times. Every one of them has its own unique ability and provides big advantages to the player who earned it.
Terrain cards can be cities or roads. They are used for the construction of the map, and.. well - to gain victory points. No matter how strong is your deck, if you don’t have cities, you have nothing!
What we have here is 56 x 56 cm game board, city tokens to mark the level and the owner of the cities, reference sheets to help the players with the different costs in the game and the supply cards which are actually very, very important cards, as they are used for hiring units, building roads, traveling and more. 
Now, let me tell you a few words about the Sun Oracle, shortly called Orac, as it is a key element of the game. The Oracle is almighty ancient monument, eternal apprentice of the nature itself and the hand of the gods among humans and beasts. The Oracle provides advantages to the players and it could support you, if you catch the lucky moment on a sunny day... It counts the days and guides you through the never-ending competition between the folks that inhabit these lands.
Some pictures of the first prototypes and size reference.
The miniatures. There are 8 large scale miniatures which represent the players’ heroes in the game. These figures are the leaders of a player’s armies and mark players’ presence on the game board. Plus - they look amazing!
The factions.
Four factions coexist in the world of Battalia. Most of the cards in the game (units, artefacts and terrain cards) and the 8 figures belong to one of the four factions. A leading concept in the game is that the four factions can freely collaborate with each other, but many units from the same faction, using their own artefacts, are much stronger together. Also, unlike all other games where the players choose their factions, in this game the factions choose the players.

Risks and challenges
On one hand we are just a small company and this is our first Kickstarter project, but on the other we have been publishing board games for the past five years now. We are cooperating with more than 30 famous publishers like FFG, KOSMOS, Hans im Glueck, AMIGO, IELLO and others. During this time we have published Bulgarian localized editions of many worldwide popular board games such as “Game Of Thrones: The Board Game”, “Sid Meier’s Civilization”, “The Legends Of Andor”, “Ubongo”, “Carcassonne”, “Wizard”, “Atlantis”, “ King Of Tokyo”, etc… This means a lot of EXPERIENCE for us! Our production sites are located mainly in Germany, US and China, so international logistics are not an obstacle for us and meanwhile we know very well how to play the “big game” called PUBLISHING.
Please note: the estimated delivery date is mid-November 2015, but please keep in mind that this is only an informed guess. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We will do our best to minimize this as much as possible, but if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all we are always ready to refund pledges in full.
Of course, there are risks with every project, but we hope that our track record in publishing and our commitment to do everything as good as possible will gain your trust in us , dear Backer! Battalia: The Creation will be our first own “baby” and we don’t want to do anything wrong after two and a half years of development.
 Production shipping or customs delays are always possible, but since our game is 95% complete, a small delay is probably the worst thing that could occur on this project. The most sophisticated part of our project is probably the production of the Battalia heroes. Yes, exactly – these large and beautiful, but really complicated for production figurines. They are expensive, the process takes a lot of time and commitment, but the result is really worth the effort . To ensure a smooth and accurate production and delivery, we are cooperating with an old partner who is among , the best production factories in Germany - a renown specialist in the board game field with really high quality standards for everything they produce – miniatures, game material, game board, boxes and so on…. This should put everyone's minds at ease, regarding quality and delivery schedule!
We have no reason to expect that something could go terribly wrong, but in case that this happens, please check our refund policy.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, charges included, NO QUESTIONS ASKED. Please note: All refunds requested during the original 60 day period are returned to your credit card via Stripe. Refunds requested after this period will be processed via PayPal only!

campaign.story:
“How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads; to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams.” ― Bram Stoker, Dracula
Lord of the Dead is a tribute to the hex & counter microgames I used to play from the 70s & 80s, such as Chitin: I, Rivets, and Ice War. In this game, you play either an evil lord with vast necromantic powers or a mob of townfolk who have been alerted to his approach. Your object as the lord is to fight your way through the village and reach the cemetery, where you will raise an undead army. Your object as the townsfolk is to stop the villain from defiling your ancestral burial grounds and raising up his horrifying army.
Check out Lord of the Dead on Board Game Geek and join the converstations!
More content = greater replayability. And that's never a bad thing, right? Here is the expanded list of components in Lord of the Dead, including all stretch goals made possible by the Kickstarter community:
RULES: Basic rules, advanced options for neutral monsters and interactive terrain, and detailed turn descriptions for each side.
SCENARIO PACK: A set of six different scenarios, giving you options for single player, three-player (both vs. and co-op), arena mode, and even campaign-style story mode.
HEX MAP: With turn summaries, unit rosters, a tracker for health, magic, & reinforcements, and a black magic tracker.
TOWNSFOLK DIE-CUT COUNTERS: A horde of villagers and reinforcements, enough to fill 1/3rd of the entire map.
GRAY LORD of the DEAD DIE-CUT COUNTERS: Eight different lords, spell trackers, and minions, color-coded for multi-lord play.
BLUE LORD of the DEAD DIE-CUT COUNTERS: Eight different lords, spell trackers, and minions, color-coded for multi-lord play.
MONSTER DIE-CUT COUNTERS: For those who want the full experience, these randomly-spawned creatures wander around the battlefield and attack the closest unit.
DIE-CUT ATTACK CARDS: For those who prefer a more strategic, less random game, a sheet of attack cards are provided, giving you the option of diceless play.
ZIP LOCK BAGS: One large bag for the game, and several smaller bags to keep your counters and cards organized.
PRINT & PLAY: All game files are available for both 8.5"x11" and A4 paper. Print off replacements for lost components, extra copies for your friends or as reference, or beef up your game with more counters! The print & play also includes a new map: Cathedral Defense. The lord of the dead is attacking the cemetery on the print map. On this one, he's defending the cemetery from the horde of villagers.
This is the upgraded board, made possible by the generosity of this project's fantastic backers!!
The board is printed on 14 pt cover stock with UV gloss coating on both sides. The rules are on one side, the board on the other. The counters and optional diceless cards will be die-cut on a separate sheet. Just punch out the counters, add a 6-sided die (or use the cards), and you're ready to play! The game folds up small enough and light enough to be mailed as a letter, so you save money on shipping and customs. I've already tested this out with international mailings to playtesters in Australia and Europe, without any hassle at all!
One player chooses one of the eight lords of the dead: the Necromancer (the basic lord), the Banshee (with an area of effect attack),the Shadow Wraith (who is incorporeal, and so can occupy the same hex as any other unit), the Pumpkinhead (who alone among the lords has a ranged basic attack), the Vampire (who can heal himself when he hits with a basic attack),the Lich-King (a particularly powerful commander of the undead), the Demon-Prince (whose curses cannot be broken) or the Elder Horror (a brutal Lovecraftian monstrosity). Each has a starting health and harvested souls. As he takes damage, his health decreases. If his health is reduced to 0, he dies. As he casts spells, his harvested souls decrease. If his harvested souls is reduced to 0, he can no longer cast spells. He can increase souls by killing townsfolk. Few of his spells trigger immediately. Instead, he keeps track of spell progress via trackers, advancing each spell turn-by-turn until it triggers. Some trigger several turns in a row, some have a one-time effect. One, Call to the Grave, turns a villager into an undead servant. The lord has several play options available to him: leech the townsfolk's life to bolster his own, freeze them in place, kill them outright, or raise them as undead slaves.
In this early playtest, the Lich-King and Shadow Wraith team up against the villagers in a 3-player game.
The townsfolk player selects his starting army equal to the value of the lord. There are nine types of townsfolk: expendable Commoners, stronger Thugs, magic-flinging Wise Ones, aggressive Soldiers, long-ranged Foresters, swift Cavalry, creature-controlling Shaman, bomb-flinging Engineers, and anti-magic Paladins. Each is weak, compared to the dark lord, but together they are strong. As the lord nears the graveyard, the urgency of their mission grows. Unlike the lord, who must bolster his ranks by killing villagers, the townsfolk automatically grow stronger each turn and are able to summon increasing amounts of reinforcements from the garrison. Townsfolk have several play options available to them: overwhelm with cheap hordes, rain missiles from afar, or attack directly. With judicious positioning and a bit of luck, they can stop the lord.
Each unit has six stats: Speed (how far it can move each turn), Attack (how likely it will hit), Range (how far its attack reaches), Health (how many hits it takes to kill it), Harvested Souls (how much spell-casting power it has), and Cost (its overall value).

POG's space pirate game, Devils & Black Sheep, is in the final 24 hours of the campaign. This is the first game I've designed from the beginning to be die-cut, so it's kind of a proof of concept. It hasn't actually proven to be any more popular than my non die-cut games, so I'm not certain that I'll bother continuing to pursue die cutting. Almost a year ago, riding high on a wave of ideas from the 2015 Emerald City Comicon, I sat down with my kids and began solidifying a few game ideas. I launched the first one, Lords of the Dead, hoping and crossing fingers that I would get enough interest to cover the $900 production cost. But I thought I had an even chance of failing.
A year later, thanks ENTIRELY to you guys, to the original backers of Lord of the Dead, I have a new company, I've created six games, and I had nearly a dozen sit-downs with potential licensors at the 2016 Emerald City Comicon. I'm working with video game companies, comic book publishers, New York Times bestselling authors, and even other Kickstarter creators to bring their creations to life as games.

campaign.story:
After yet another year of evil machinations, BD Games is proud to bring an expansion to Assault on Doomrock, as well as a second edition of the base game.
Those of you willing to endure a uniquely ridiculous journey and those of you not frightened of being eaten by flying sharks, please continue.
I welcome you, Heroes. It is time for an adventure.
I just hope the dragon will take it easy on you during your first run.
Assault on Doomrock is a cooperative game set in a fantasy world, that can be played by 1 to 4 players. A complete adventure takes from 2 to 3 hours.
What is the gameplay like?
Step 1 - Gather the party!
Generate your hero by combining a hero card and a trait card. Grab your set of ability cards, dice, health tokens and steel yourself for a difficult journey. The game is quite challenging!
Step 2 - Adventuring!
Travel through the randomly assembled deck of area cards. Explore locations, complete objectives, experience events and look for gold and trouble. Try reaching Doomrock Mountain in time.
Step 3 - Gear up!
Buy, loot, or steal awesome gear! You would especially like these epic items the dragon is sleeping on.
Step 4 - Level up
Spend silver to level up during camps. Draw 3 random cards and keep one. Don't be surprised if your warrior friend suddenly starts shooting fireballs from his eyes! Whatever combinations work between your party members.
Step 5 - Do battle!
In order to win the game you must overcome 3 random and increasingly difficult encounters.
The battles play out in a unique system, that does not use a grid or distance measuring, yet provides a wide array of tactical options. There are no player turns, heroes perform their actions in any order they like. This opens opportunities for a lot of insane party combinations.
In battles heroes roll dice at the start of the round and assign them to ability cards to plan their round as a party.
Enemies are controlled by their dedicated artificial intelligence decks. This creates thematic encounters that play out differently every time.
Why do we think Assault on Doomrock is special?
1. Variable scenarios
Almost every aspect of the game is assembled randomly from decks of cards: heroes, hero traits, encounters, abilities, common items, epic items, adventure areas, objectives, events, encounters. This makes every game play out differently. There are nearly 300 cards in the game and almost every card is unique.

2. Level up system
You are not limited in which direction you develop your character and looking for crazy combos between your party members is satisfying.

3. True cooperation
There is no 'me' in this game, there is only 'we'. You control your own character during battles but group planning is essential.

4. Humor
It’s lighthearted, and a bit absurd but we never go overboard with it.

5. Battle system
Unique. Simple rules, giving a wide array of tactical options. No player turns, an exciting planning phase with dice allocation, minimal randomness when determining damage. Intelligent enemies without an ‘overlord player’'.

6. Role player friendly
The abstract nature of battles and actions on the adventure map sets an excellent ground for player narration.

If you would like to see how the game plays, I recommend the original Rahdo Runthrough video:
Rahdo gets it! Although please keep in mind that this video has been recorded with a prototype of the base game.
The second edition of the base game features some balance tweaks, corrected card texts, and a revised rulebook.The quality of the components remains the same as in first edition.
Almost 300 cards and over 150 tokens!
The 8 promo cards from the original Indiegogo campaign are included in the second edition.
.
The base game is required in order to use the contents of the expansion.
Doompocalypse features additional cards for all the decks in the base game.
Two new heroes join the battle in the expansion.
The hardcore Bard and the dominant Commander both focus on teamwork oriented mechanics. Although the bard would argue that he is not 'the support act'. He is the main event.
New areas such as the Hidden stash or Lonely tower will riddle the adventure map with decisions. Just do not get distracted by all the ladies, heroes. Focus on the quest!
There are new enemies. Hope you are looking for a challenge, because they sure are tough. Battle the shark tornado, heart of darkness, armored skeletons, sneaky elven archers and more.
The encounters are presented on a new large card format, containing visualized battle setup. Each encounter card from the base game is included in the expansion, redone in the large format. Some effects have been tweaked and rebalanced, introducing additional AI cards and giving the old encounters some new life.
Battle these enemies with original new items. Guns, throwing weapons, impossible new artifacts and accessories required to be operated by 2 heroes. These will change how you approach some of the battles.
A set of new level up abilities is also added. Both utility skills and attacks in this expansion accentuate cooperation within the party.
We revisited the trait cards in this expansion, recreating old traits and adding a couple of new ones. These traits allow actions to be performed during the roll phase, if a specific set of dice results is achieved. Pushing your luck during roll phase has never been this interesting.
Last but not least, battles now feature terrain elements, drafted from a random pool for every encounter. These objects, when approached, can be used by both the heroes and enemies, providing another layer of depth to the system.
Slide on shields from a hill. Move your party members with a barrel. Throw enemies into bonfires. Flip tables and take cover behind them. Throw acorns at bosses! Fall into deadly traps! Yeah!
If you would like to learn more about terrain in the expansion, check out these previews:
Flipping tables
Traps and hazards
The mule
What do you get in the expansion?
Expansion rulebook
6 new large scale encounter cards
9 large scale revisited encounter cards from the base game
46 artificial intelligence cards for the new encounters
6 artificial intelligence cards for old encounters
2 hero cards
10 trait cards
2 setting cards
8 area cards
15 terrain cards with around 20 terrain tokens.
2 large tokens for dividing the battlefield
8 starting ability cards
12 level up ability cards
10 common item cards
10 epic item cards
8 wilderness event cards
8 mountain event cards
5 additional silver/gold tokens
Extra heroism/shield and secret/time markers in quantity that will fill the remaining space on punch-boards (exact quantity currently unknown).
The final contents of the expansion may be expanded by several cards and tokens from stretch goals.
The final number of components may vary slightly.

Please note that with exception of the first stretch goal, the rest affects only the content of the expansion.
The second edition of the base game went through minor balance and text error corrections. As a sign of respect for our original supporters, we are releasing an upgrade pack that will set your cards from first edition on par with the second edition. This upgrade is free for everyone ordering only the expansion, either via worldwide delivery, or Essen pickup.
If you would like to improve your base game without ordering the expansion, you may order it via a separate pledge.
The upgrade pack consists of approximately 40 cards and a revised rulebook. The exact final contents of the upgrade pack may vary slightly.
Please note that, if you ordered the base game via this Kickstarter campaign, you do not need an upgrade pack, since the version you ordered is the second edition.
The upgrade pack is a one-time Kickstarter offer. It is very unlikely that it will become available anywhere else.
 As a sign of appreciation for our supporters, each non-anonymous supporter's name will be engraved on the wall of doom, situated around the sides of the inner box part and box insert.
We barely had enough room to place all the names on the sides of the box during the last campaign, so we will now also use the box insert if need be. However, names will be split between two boxes now.
Each supporter ordering the base game or base game with the expansion, will have his name printed on the base game box.
Each supporter ordering only the expansion, or simply supporting us, will have his name printed on the expansion's box.
BD Games is a young game development company located in Poland.
Today it is basically a two man show, consisting of the company owner and lead designer:
Tom Stasiak and a co-designer and editor: Christopher Niewiadomski. Bartosz Pławecki, with his unique art style, is engaged in this project as our primary illustrator.
We are gamers of all genres and platforms, making games out of passion. The ones we would like to play.
With last year's Assault on Doomrock release, we earned the trust of many gamers with our original approach and attention to detail.
With numerous new ideas in mind, in the future we would like continue to develop quality games for the undeniably awesome board gaming community.
Support us!
If you think this project is worth supporting, please share this project on your social media.
BD games is just 2 guys who are not big with social media. Any help with spreading the word about this project is greatly appreciated!
This Kickstarter campaign has been prepared in collaboration with Mage Company. .
http://www.magecompany.com/
This is the state of the project at the date of Kickstarter launch.
The base game has been developed and released in 2014. Second edition in an upgraded version almost ready and waiting to be produced. We are just making a few final decisions regarding some balance factors.
We have been working on the expansion for a year now and it is in its final stages of development in both the gameplay and graphical department.
What we ask for are funds required for production and delivery of the games.
Our primary goal all along was to bring the expansion to the Essen 2015 fair for pick up and send the Kickstarter copies worldwide just after the fair.
This is a goal similar to the one we had in 2014 with the Indiegogo campaign. We assumed to deliver the games in November, but non Europe backers were receiving them until mid January. This was our first project.
This year we speak from experience. The estimated delivery time is by the end of year for Europe and USA. Some countries like Australia or Canada may receive the games in early 2016, due to longer shipping time. The games will be shipped from Poland.
